This position is ideal for someone who enjoys digital marketing, ads management, and light creative work, with some flexibility for admin support.



Crossover shift

(No phone work required)

             - Create and manage Google Ads and
 Ads

 follow-ups, newsletters, and review requests

 page content and updates

Qualifications

              - Experience with Google Ads and/or
 Ads

              - Organized, detail-oriented, and reliable

              - Comfortable working independently

              - Good written English communication skills

.

title: Video Editor
description:
We are looking for a reliable and creative Video Editor to support ongoing content creation and marketing videos. This role will focus mainly on short-form and marketing content, with opportunities to grow into more advanced video projects over time.



This is a full-time remote position with flexible or crossover hours. You do not need to follow strict U.S. working hours, but there will be set times for meetings.





Job duties and responsibilities:

 

      1. Edit video content for:

               - Organic social media (reels, short-form videos)

               - Marketing campaigns

               - Personal brand content

               - Client-facing promotional materials

        2. Produce engaging, high-quality edits at scale

        3. Follow written briefs and creative instructions accurately

        4. Implement revisions and feedback efficiently

        5. Organize video assets and maintain clean project files

        6. Communicate clearly regarding timelines, questions, and updates

        7. Collaborate with the creative team and adapt to different brand styles

        8. Gradually take on more complex and higher-end projects as skills allow



Qualifications

         - Proven experience as a Video Editor (portfolio or sample work required)

         - Strong working knowledge of Adobe Premiere (required)

         - Ability to edit short-form and marketing videos efficiently

         - Good understanding of basic video editing principles (cuts, pacing, audio, captions)

         - Strong English comprehension and communication skills

         - Ability to follow written instructions and creative briefs

         - Detail-oriented, organized, and reliable with deadlines

         - Open to feedback and willing to learn and improve

         - Able to work independently in a remote setup





Preferred / Nice to Have



            - Experience with DaVinci Resolve (especially for color grading)

            - Experience with Canva

            - Background in editing content for social media or digital marketing





If you believe you're a strong fit for this position, please respond with the following:



     1. A link to your resume in PDF format. 

          Your resume should include your contact details, a recent professional photo, and a summary of your work 

          experience, emphasizing tasks relevant to this role.



      2. A screenshot of your PC specifications and internet speed, 

      3. A one-minute Vocaroo recording of your self-introduction

      4. Your WhatsApp number for easy communication. 



To ensure you've read this message carefully, please include the word "VIDEOEDITING" in the subject line of your
.

title: Video Editor (High Autonomy / Flexible Schedule) – $700/mo
description:
THE ROLE: Professional Freedom



I’m looking for a professional Video Editor who thrives on autonomy. This is a "Freedom Job" I don’t believe in micro-management or tracking your every move. You’ll have the flexibility to work at your own pace and manage your own schedule, as long as the work is exceptional and deadlines are hit.

I need a storyteller, not just a "clip cutter." You’ll be working on a mix of corporate and creative edits that require a deep understanding of pacing, rhythm, and technical workflows.



THE VIBE: High Standards & Grit



While this role offers a lot of flexibility, it is a professional position.



The Pace: I’m looking for someone who aims to build speed and efficiency over time.



The Pressure: Most days are smooth, but it can be a high-pressure environment when big projects land. I need someone who stays level-headed and keeps their focus when the workload gets heavy or the deadlines get tight.



COMPENSATION & TERMS

Salary: $700 USD per month.

Payment: Paid consistently on the last Friday of every month.

Schedule: Monday to Friday (Work when you want).

Equipment: You must have your own professional editing suite and high-speed hardware.

Perks: Holidays are included.



?? APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (READ CAREFULLY) ??



I want to see your talent, not a document. Do not send me a CV or a Resume. CVs will be dismissed immediately.

To apply, please provide EXACTLY 5 links to your absolute best work.

No more than 5. * No fewer than 5. * No "General Portfolio" links.

I want to see the 5 pieces of work you are most proud of that demonstrate your range in corporate and creative storytelling. If you can follow these instructions, we’re already off to a great start.

title: Acquisition Specialist (Real Estate)
description:
Acquisition Specialist (Real Estate Wholesaling)



Company: Homeward Partners

Location: Remote (Central Time)

Job Type: Full-Time | 44–48 hrs/week

Compensation: Base Pay + Commissions + Performance Bonuses



About Homeward Partners



Homeward Partners is a fast-growing real estate investment firm specializing in acquiring off-market residential properties directly from homeowners. Our mission is to create win-win solutions — helping sellers achieve peace of mind while building strong, ethical real estate deals that create value for everyone involved.



We buy distressed, inherited, pre-foreclosure, vacant, or problem properties — always focusing on transparency, empathy, and integrity.



As an Acquisition Specialist, you are the first or second voice sellers hear from us — the bridge between their challenges and our solutions.



Your Mission



Your job is to connect with motivated sellers, uncover their real needs, and help negotiate win-win purchase agreements for our company.

You’ll represent Homeward Partners with professionalism, empathy, and drive — moving conversations from first contact to signed contracts.



Key Responsibilities



Seller Outreach & Communication

Call, text, and
 inbound/outbound seller leads.

Build rapport and trust through active listening, not pressure tactics.

Qualify sellers based on motivation, timeline, property condition, and financial situation.

Ask diagnostic questions to uncover challenges like inheritance, title issues, or foreclosure risks.



Deal Analysis & Negotiation

Evaluate property values using tools like PropStream, Zillow, or Redfin.

Analyze motivation and market data to make fair, strategic offers.

Negotiate purchase agreements that align with company goals while maintaining win-win outcomes for sellers.

Submit qualified deals to the Disposition Team with all relevant details and comps.



CRM & Follow-Up Management

Maintain consistent CRM updates for every seller conversation, note, and offer.

Schedule timely follow-ups for unconverted leads.

Track and report KPIs such as calls made, quality conversations, offers presented, and contracts signed.



Team Collaboration

Coordinate with the Disposition Team to ensure deal handoffs are smooth.

Share feedback and insights from sellers to improve marketing and acquisition targeting.

Participate in sales meetings, training sessions, and roleplays to sharpen skills.



Tools You’ll Use

CRM: ReSimpli or Podio

Dialer: CallTools, Readymode, Mojo, BatchDialer

Property Data: PropStream, Zillow, Redfin, ChatGPT (for comps)

Communication: Google Workspace, Slack, WhatsApp

Tracking: Google Sheets, KPI dashboards



Qualifications

1–2 years of experience in real estate acquisitions, cold calling, or high-volume sales.

Excellent English communication skills (verbal and written).

Strong negotiation and problem-solving skills with a focus on empathy.

Organized, detail-oriented, and consistent with CRM documentation.

Comfortable working full-time U.S. hours (Central or Eastern Time).

Tech-savvy and able to learn new systems quickly.



Preferred Experience:

Prior experience talking to distressed or motivated sellers.

Understanding of real estate transactions, contracts, and title processes.

Familiarity with DISC personality profiles and rapport-based communication.



Compensation & Growth

Base hourly rate (DOE) + generous commissions per closed assignment

Performance-based bonuses

Paid training and continuous support

Clear promotion path to Senior Disposition Manager / Team Lead

Long-term opportunity with a fast-scaling U.S. investment firm



How to Apply

Please share a 1–2 minute video introduction in English talking about your background, communication experience, and why you’d be a great fit for this role.

Drop your WhatsApp as well for Quick Communication.

title: Disposition Specialist (Real Estate)
description:
Disposition Manager (Real Estate Wholesaling)



Company: Homeward Partners (U.S.-based Real Estate Investment Firm)

Location: Remote (Central Time)

Employment Type: Full-Time (48 hrs/week)

Start Date: Immediate

Compensation: Base Pay + Commissions per Closed Deal + Performance Bonuses



About Homeward Partners



Homeward Partners is a fast-growing real estate investment company specializing in buying off-market residential properties and selling them to a curated network of cash buyers and investors. We focus on transparency, speed, and results — offering sellers quick, fair deals and investors high-value opportunities.



As our Disposition Manager, you’ll be responsible for turning signed contracts into closed deals — marketing properties, managing buyer relationships, negotiating assignments, and coordinating closings.



Core Mission

Your mission is simple: turn inventory into cash by selling contracts quickly and profitably while maintaining strong relationships with our investor network.



Key Responsibilities



Property Marketing & Buyer Outreach

Launch new deals to buyers within hours of contract execution.

Market properties using
 campaigns, CRM blasts,
 groups, Craigslist, and other investor channels.

Create engaging property listings and buyer packets with all key details (ARV, comps, rehab estimates, pictures).



Buyer Relations & Negotiation

Build, grow, and maintain a strong network of cash buyers and investor partners.

Negotiate assignment fees and contract terms that maximize company profit.

Follow up daily with buyers through calls, texts, and
s to create urgency and close quickly.



Transaction Coordination

Coordinate with title companies, escrow officers, and attorneys to ensure smooth closings.

Track deal progress, resolve title or buyer issues, and maintain clear communication across all parties.

Ensure accurate, compliant documentation for each transaction.



Market Research & Feedback Loop

Run comps using PropStream, Zillow, Redfin, and ChatGPT tools.

Stay updated on local market conditions, investor trends, and pricing benchmarks.

Provide insights to the acquisitions team for better property selection and pricing strategy.



Reporting & CRM Management

Keep CRM updated with all buyer interactions, notes, and statuses.

Track KPIs: time-to-market, engagement, contracts assigned, and closing ratios.

Generate weekly disposition performance reports for management review.



Tools You’ll Use

CRM: ReSimpli, Podio, or InvestorLift

Property Data: PropStream, Zillow, Redfin

Communication: CallTools / BatchDialer / Google Workspace

Marketing:
/SMS tools, Canva, ChatGPT,
/Craigslist

Tracking: Google Sheets, KPI Dashboards



Qualifications

1–3 years of experience in real estate wholesaling, dispositions, or investment sales.

Strong negotiation, relationship-building, and communication skills.

Confident with property valuation, comps, and real estate contracts.

Excellent written and spoken English.

Tech-savvy, detail-oriented, and capable of working independently.

Self-motivated and results-driven, with a passion for closing deals.

Preferred:



Existing network of U.S. real estate investors and cash buyers.

Familiarity with ReSimpli, InvestorLift, or similar CRM platforms.

Experience with
 marketing for real estate.

Compensation & Growth

Base hourly rate (DOE) + generous commissions per closed assignment

Performance-based bonuses

Paid training and continuous support

Clear promotion path to Senior Disposition Manager / Team Lead

Long-term opportunity with a fast-scaling U.S. investment firm



How to Apply

Please share a 1–2 minute video introduction in English talking about your background, communication experience, and why you’d be a great fit for this role.

Drop your WhatsApp as well for Quick Communication.

Outreach and coordination

Clear

title: Video Editor for E-commerce Ads
description:
Hello!



We run several branded e-commerce stores in the Nordic market and are looking for a Video Editor for Ads to join our team long-term. This is an execution role focused on creating high-performing ad videos, not influencer or vlog-style editing.



What you’ll do:



• Edit ad videos using provided B-rolls and assets

• Create videos from pre-written scripts and sometimes write scripts yourself

• Generate and integrate AI voiceovers

• Sync subtitles accurately with audio and visuals

• Structure videos for performance (hooks, pacing, clarity)

• Adapt and translate videos for different markets

• Analyze existing ads and improve them

• Follow SOPs, templates, and internal guidelines



Tools & workflow:



• Main tool: CapCut (experience here is important)

• Clear instructions and examples are always provided

• You must follow instructions precisely and think independently when needed

• We use AI tools as part of our workflow



Workload & schedule:



• Starting at ~10 hours per week

• Flexible working hours

• Can increase to 30–40 hours per week if performance is strong



Requirements:



• Video editing experience or solid practical knowledge is required

• Must be a fast learner and comfortable with modern tools

• Strong attention to detail

• Able to work independently and solve problems

• Reliable and consistent



We value:



• Strong execution

• Willingness to learn and improve

• Long-term mindset

• Creative thinking combined with structure



Growth opportunities:



This role is ideal for junior to intermediate editors who want to grow into a high-level ad editor over time, with increased pay based on performance. This is a long-term role, and high performers can grow into roles such as:



• Senior video editor

• Creative strategist

• Ads / performance-focused roles



How to apply:



Send a short message explaining why we should choose you, and start your application with the word “strawberry” so we know you read everything.

title: WFH OUTBOUND TELEPHONE RECRUITER - Php 50-60K Base + High Commissions!!!

RLS is a global recruiting and consulting firm, expanding our remote team in the Philippines. title: ClickUp Systems Architect & Automation Specialist (Agency Operations)
description:
We are looking for an experienced ClickUp Systems Architect to help us consolidate and systemise operations for a growing web design and digital marketing agency.



At present, our infrastructure is spread across tools such as Slack, Google Drive, Google Sheets, and documented SOPs. Part of this engagement will involve reducing tool sprawl by moving communication, workflows, and task management into ClickUp wherever appropriate.



Certain platforms — such as Go High Level (GHL) — will remain core systems and must be integrated cleanly into the overall workflow.



This role is about designing ClickUp as the central operating system, not simply maintaining an existing setup.



What You’ll Be Working With



Existing SOPs and partial documentation



Slack-based communication and handovers (to be reduced or replaced)



Google Drive and Google Sheets used for tracking and reporting



Go High Level (GHL) as a core CRM and automation platform



A team delivering web design, SEO, ads, and content services



You will work closely with the agency owner and key tea
mbers to:



Map how work currently happens



Identify what should move into ClickUp



D
 what should remain external (e.g. GHL)



Build a cleaner, more scalable operating system



Key Responsibilities

Process Mapping & Tool Consolidation



Work with leadership and tea
mbers to map existing workflows



Identify inefficiencies, duplication, and tool overlap



Design a ClickUp-first operating model where appropriate



Reduce reliance on Slack by shifting workflows, updates, and approvals into ClickUp



ClickUp Architecture & Build



Design the overall ClickUp workspace structure (Spaces, Folders, Lists)



Build workflows for different service lines (web, SEO, ads, content)



Create status flows that reflect real delivery stages



Build task templates, dependencies, and custom fields



Automation & Integration



Build advanced ClickUp automations



Integrate ClickUp with Go High Level (GHL) where required



Use n8n to connect systems where native automations are insufficient



Reduce manual handoffs between tools



Documentation & Enablement



Document systems, workflows, and logic



Create Loom walkthroughs or written SOPs



Support internal handover and adoption



Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)



You must have:



Deep experience designing and building ClickUp for agencies or service-based businesses



Strong understanding of ClickUp architecture and advanced automations



Experience consolidating workflows across multiple tools



Ability to work from incomplete or evolving process documentation



Confidence explaining why certain tools should be replaced, retained, or integrated



Highly Desirable (Bonus Skills)



Experience with n8n or similar automation tools



Experience integrating ClickUp with CRM platforms such as Go High Level



Background working with digital marketing or web agencies



Strong systems-thinking and documentation skills



Engagement Type



Project-based engagement to start



Potential for ongoing optimisation and systems ownership



Scope, timeline, and budget to be agreed



How to Apply (Important)



To apply, please include:



A short overview of your ClickUp experience



Examples of ClickUp systems you’ve built (screenshots or Looms)



An example of a workflow where you replaced or consolidated tools



Any experience with n8n or advanced integrations



Your availability and preferred engagement structure



Include the word “SYSTEMS” in the first line of your application.



Applications without examples will not be considered.

title: Senior Digital Marketing and Growth Manager
description:
Remote role. Competitive pay. Real Impact. Are you our next Senior Digital Marketing & Growth Manager?



This is not an entry-level position.



About Us:

• OLIVIA Professional Solutions helps U.S. home care businesses scale through highly trained Filipino Virtual Assistants. We’re a fast-growing, mission-driven company founded by a Filipino-American healthcare entrepreneur.



Offer Begins at:

• $1,200 per month (USD/US Dollar)

• 40 hours per week

• Full-TIme



Start Date: 

• ASAP



Schedule:

• 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM EST (US Eastern Time)

• Monday to Friday

• Time tracked by Hubstaff



Location: 

• Remote | 100% Work From Home

• Philippines-Based Candidates Preferred



Role Overview:

• OLIVIA Professional Solutions is engaging a Senior Digital Marketing & Growth Manager to lead and scale the company’s digital growth strategy. This role owns the full marketing engine, from demand generation and recruitment marketing to brand expansion and conversion optimization.

• This is a long-term, independent contractor engagement under a deliverables-based agreement. The contractor is expected to operate with a high level of autonomy, strategic ownership, and accountability, independently planning, executing, and optimizing marketing initiatives aligned with company growth objectives.

• The Senior Digital Marketing & Growth Manager will report directly to the Director of Operations and collaborate closely with company leadership to ensure marketing outcomes support revenue growth, recruitment goals, and new business initiatives.



Core Responsibilities:

• Own and lead all digital marketing, growth, and lead generation efforts across channels, ensuring consistent and measurable results aligned with company growth goals.

• Develop, execute, and continuously optimize data-driven marketing strategies that generate qualified leads, sales meetings, and recruitment applications.

• Assess and improve all marketing assets, systems, funnels, and campaigns, identifying gaps and implementing actionable enhancements in branding, messaging, and conversion performance.

• Manage and optimize GoHighLevel CRM, including automations, pipelines, nurture campaigns, and reporting systems that support scalability and visibility.

• Plan, launch, manage, and optimize paid advertising campaigns across
, Google, and LinkedIn with clear accountability for performance and ROI.

• Plan and execute webinars and virtual events that drive lead generation, authority building, and partnership opportunities.

• Design and execute recruitment marketing and employer branding initiatives to attract and convert high-quality virtual assistants.

• Oversee and strengthen the company’s digital presence, including Google My Business and all relevant online platforms, ensuring brand consistency and visibility.

• Collaborate with leadership to design and roll out marketing initiatives supporting client acquisition, franchise partnerships, affiliate programs, and other growth initiatives.

• Provide strategic direction and oversight to the Digital Marketing Specialist and other marketing contractors, ensuring alignment with strategy, standards, and performance expectations.

• Support hands-on campaign execution as needed, particularly during pilot initiatives, transitions, or high-impact launches.

• Define, track, and report on key marketing KPIs through dashboards and performance reports, driving accountability, insights, and continuous optimization.

• Plan and execute strategic marketing campaigns aligned with CEO participation in U.S. conferences and industry events to maximize visibility, lead generation, and partnership opportunities.



Contractor Requirements:

• Minimum of 3 years of proven experience in digital marketing management, growth strategy, and lead generation.

• Demonstrated ability to deliver measurable results through strategic planning, execution, and optimization.

• Experience managing multi-channel marketing campaigns, including paid media, social platforms, CRM funnels,
, and automation.

• Strong working knowledge of analytics, marketing automation systems, and recruitment marketing strategies.

• Hands-on experience with GoHighLevel or comparable CRM and funnel platforms.

• Proven capability in planning and executing webinars or digital events for lead generation and authority building.

• Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.

• Highly data-driven, proactive, and capable of working independently with minimal supervision.

• Owns and maintains the tools, software, and systems required to perform the work as an independent contractor.

• Professional, self-directed, and accountable for outcomes, not just activity.



Ideal Qualities:

• We are looking for a self-motivated strategist who operates independently with minimal oversight.

• Can quickly evaluate what’s working and what’s not.

• Thinks creatively and critically to design campaigns that deliver tangible results.

• Can confidently discuss real-world marketing experience and results (not AI-generated plans).



Why Join Us?

• Start with a competitive salary.

• Work remotely with a fast-growing company.

• Be part of a mission-driven company helping both U.S. business owners and Filipino professionals thrive.

• Work alongside a visionary founder and a small but mighty and growing operations team. 



APPLY NOW by sending the following requirements:



1. Your updated Portfolio/Resume/CV



2. A brief 2-3 minute intro video recording sharing your experience and why we should work with you. This will help our team screen better. Please ensure that your video recording is accessible to view.



3. Send all application requirements through the link below and click APPLY NOW:

title: Senior Customer Service Role
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a highly organised, proactive, and fluent English-speaking Customer Service Representative to support our operations team remotely.



This is a senior, operations-facing customer service role, not a call-centre position. You will act as a key communication link between customers, internal teams, contractors, and management, while also supporting invoicing, reporting, and operational coordination.



The ideal candidate is calm under pressure, confident handling difficult conversations, and comfortable working closely with senior leadership in a fast-paced, service-based environment.



Reporting & Collaboration



Reports directly to:

Back Office Manager

Office Manager

Works closely with:

Managing Director

Operations Manager

Field teams, contractors, and subcontractors



Working Hours

Monday to Friday: 7:30 AM – 4:30 PM

Saturday: Half-day (rotational or as required)

All hours are South Australia time, including daylight saving adjustments.



Key Responsibilities

Customer Communication & Liaison

Act as the primary point of contact for assigned customers.

Manage communication with customers, internal teams, and external contractors.

Maintain clear, professional, and timely written and verbal communication.

Set, manage, and meet customer expectations.

Conflict Resolution & Problem Solving

Handle customer complaints and service issues calmly and professionally.

Coordinate with operations, contractors, and management to resolve issues.

Proactively identify risks before they escalate.

Accurately document issues and resolutions in CRM systems.

Operations & Coordination

Coordinate job-related communication between customers and field teams.

Assist with scheduling and resource allocation support.

Manage multiple priorities without sacrificing accuracy or professionalism.

Invoicing & Payments

Issue invoices for customers within your portfolio.

Track outstanding invoices and follow up on overdue payments.

Communicate professionally regarding payments and account status.

Apply negotiation skills where appropriate, in line with company guidelines.

Reporting & Executive Support



Prepare and present a weekly executive report covering:

Customers with issues

Customers without issues

Resolved cases

Outstanding risks

New opportunities (upsells, additional services, efficiencies)

Deliver clear, structured insights suitable for executive-level meetings.

Systems & Data Management



Maintain accurate records in:

ServiceM8 (or similar service management systems)

CRM platforms

Customer portals



Confidently use:

Excel (tracking, reporting, basic data analysis)

Word (professional documents and reports)

Analyse customer and operational data to identify trends and improvements.



Required Skills & Experience

Essential

Exceptional English proficiency (spoken and written) — non-negotiable

Strong customer service and stakeholder management experience

Proven ability to handle conflict and difficult conversations

Excellent organisational skills and attention to detail

Strong problem-solving and proactive mindset

Experience with CRM and service management systems

Confident using Excel and Word

Ability to work independently in a remote environment



Preferred

Experience in construction, maintenance, cleaning, gardening, building, renovations, or similar service industries

Experience working with Australian customers or businesses

Aged 28+ preferred (professional maturity and judgment valued)

iPhone ownership (advantageous but not required)

Technical & Work Environment Requirements

Reliable personal computer (desktop or laptop)

Stable, high-speed internet connection

Quiet, professional home office environment:

No background noise (e.g. animals, traffic, household disruptions)

Suitable for professional client and internal calls



Recruitment Process

Initial Screening – HR shortlisting

Interview 1 – Managing Director

Interview 2 – Office Manager



Includes:

Simple maths assessment

Reading comprehension test

Two practical case scenarios (customer service & problem-solving)

Interview 3 – Operations Manager

Candidates must successfully pass all three interviews.



Training & Onboarding

Full training provided on:

ServiceM8

CRM systems

Customer portals

Internal procedures and reporting

Ongoing support throughout the onboarding period



Personal Attributes We Value

Highly organised and structured

Calm and composed under pressure

Proactive and solutions-focused

Confident, professional communicator

Trustworthy and reliable

Comfortable supporting senior leadership

Able to identify both problems and opportunities

title: Real Estate Media Quality Control & Photo Editor
description:
ABOUT US



We're a rapidly growing real estate media company in the United States serving professional real estate agents. We specialize in fast-turnaround professional photography. We're scaling aggressively and need reliable help with our production operations.



---



THE ROLE: Media Quality Control & Photo Editor



You'll handle our complete photo processing and delivery workflow, allowing our team to focus on client acquisition and growth. This is systematic production work using our established tools and quality standards - not creative editing or client-facing work.



---



WHAT YOU'LL DO:



- Process raw photo files through our editing workflow

- Perform quality control on edited images

- Handle light touch-ups and corrections as needed

- Upload finalized photos to our client delivery platform

- Schedule deliveries according to service level commitments

- Track orders and status in our project management system

- Communicate any issues or questions via team chat

- Maintain our quality standards and turnaround time commitments



WORKFLOW: You'll follow our documented step-by-step process for each order. We'll train you on everything.



---



TOOLS & SYSTEMS:



You'll be trained on our complete tech stack, including:

- Cloud-based photo editing platform (AI-assisted)

- Client delivery and gallery system

- File sharing and storage (Dropbox/Google Drive)

- Project tracking (Google Sheets)

- Team communication (Slack)

- Basic photo editing tools for touch-ups



NO PRIOR EXPERIENCE WITH OUR SPECIFIC TOOLS REQUIRED - we'll train you. But you must be comfortable learning cloud-based software quickly.



---



SCHEDULE & AVAILABILITY:



- Work hours: 12pm-8pm US Central Time 

- Starting commitment: 15-20 hours per week

- Growth potential: 30-40+ hours per week as our volume increases

- Must have reliable high-speed internet (minimum 10 Mbps upload for photo files)

- Busiest days are mid-week (Tuesday-Thursday)



---



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:



MUST HAVE:

- Photo editing experience (real estate, product photography, or similar)

- Comfortable with cloud-based tools and workflows

- Extremely detail-oriented with quality focus

- Excellent written English for documentation

- Reliable internet connection and quiet workspace

- Available to start within 7 days

- Comfortable with systematic, repeatable work



HIGHLY PREFERRED:

- Real estate photography or media production experience

- Experience with AI tools

- Previously worked US hours

- Fast learner who can master new tools quickly

- Self-starter who can work independently once trained



---



COMPENSATION & GROWTH:



STARTING PAY: $7/hour USD

STARTING HOURS: 15-20 hours per week  

PAYMENT STRUCTURE: Starting hourly, potential to move to per-project rate after probation period



GROWTH TRAJECTORY:

As our business scales, the right person will have opportunity to:

- Increase to 30-40 hours per week

- Transition to performance-based compensation

- Take on additional responsibilities or training roles

- Grow income significantly as volume increases



This is NOT a short-term project - we're building a long-term team.



---



WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT:



Work exclusively with one company (not juggling multiple clients)

Clear, documented processes (not "figure it out yourself")

Fast-growing business (your role grows with us)

Direct communication with leadership

We value efficiency - suggest improvements and we'll listen

Stable, recurring work (not feast-or-famine)



---



TO APPLY - ANSWER THESE QUESTIONS:



Please include ALL of the following in your application (incomplete applications will be ignored):



1. EXPERIENCE:

   • Describe your photo editing background

   • Have you worked with real estate or property photography?

   • What editing platforms/tools have you used?



2. TECHNICAL SETUP:

   • What is your internet upload speed? (Test at fast.com)

   • Do you have a backup internet option if your main connection fails?

   • What hours are you available within our 12pm-8pm Central window?



3. WORK STYLE:

   • Describe a time you maintained quality while working under tight deadlines

   • How do you handle repetitive, systematic work?

   • What do you do when you encounter a problem you don't know how to solve?



4. LOGISTICS:

   • When can you start?

   • Are you comfortable working Philippines graveyard shift long-term?

   • Are you currently working other jobs? If yes, can you commit to our schedule?



5. PORTFOLIO (if available):

   • Link to examples of photos you've edited (real estate preferred)

   • OR briefly describe your typical editing workflow



---



THIS ROLE IS NOT:

- Creative photography or artistic editing

- Client communication or customer service

- Social media management

- Sales or marketing



THIS ROLE IS:

- Systematic photo processing workflow

- Quality control and attention to detail

- Reliable, consistent execution

- Following established processes

- Contributing to a fast-growing team



---



IMPORTANT: Due to the proprietary nature of our workflows and tools, detailed information about our specific systems will be shared only with candidates selected for interviews. We'll provide everything you need to know during the hiring process.



If you're detail-oriented, reliable, experienced with photo editing, and ready to commit to this role, apply now with complete answers to all questions above.



Applications without complete answers will not be considered.

title: Technical Customer Support Specialist (Remote)
description:
About Us:

Flow is a fully digital third party call center that assists companies with their customer support service. We manage incoming chats and
s, specializing in customer support. 



As a growing company, we are actively adding services to our project list that help our customers optimize their operations. We are looking for Technical Customer Support Specialists who are not only tech-savvy but also possess exceptional problem-solving skills and a dedication to providing a "concierge-style" customer experience. If you are someone who thrives in a fast-paced, technical environment, and has a deep understanding of system operations and their importance, we want to hear from you!



Key Responsibilities:

* Critical Problem Solving: Use your strong analytical skills to troubleshoot complex technical issues and resolve them quickly while ensuring customer satisfaction.

* System Understanding: Demonstrate a deep understanding of the systems and technologies you support, explaining how each component fits together and how it impacts the customer’s experience.

* Concierge-Style Service: Provide exceptional, high-touch service with a customer-first mentality, offering tailored solutions and ensuring every interaction feels personal and valued.

* Technical Support: Assist customers with a variety of technical issues related to our products/services, including software configurations, system optimizations, and network troubleshooting.

* Fast-Paced Resolution: Work in a fast-paced environment where quick thinking and decisiveness are essential, while maintaining calm and clarity under pressure.

* Documentation and Reporting: Keep thorough records of all support tickets, interactions, and resolutions to ensure timely follow-up and continuous process improvement.

* Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, product teams, and other departments to escalate and resolve complex issues.



Qualifications:

* Proven experience in a technical support or similar role preferably in a high-stakes, fast-paced environment.

* Exceptional critical thinking and problem-solving abilities, with a strong focus on troubleshooting and understanding system dependencies.

* A deep appreciation for concierge-level customer service; always going above and beyond to ensure an exceptional customer experience.

* Ability to explain complex technical concepts to customers in clear, simple terms.

* Experience working with ticketing systems (e.g., Zendesk, Freshdesk, Intercom etc).

* Comfort working in high-pressure situations with a fast turnaround time.

* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with an emphasis on empathy, clarity, and professionalism.



Technical Customer Support Specialist (Remote)

Flow is a fully managed customer support and operations partner for fast-growing SaaS, FinTech, and AI companies. We help our clients deliver world-class customer experiences through a mix of smart people, structured systems, and evolving technology.



Our work goes far beyond answering tickets — we think like our customers’ internal teams. We diagnose root causes, improve processes, and continuously raise the bar for how support should feel.



We’re now hiring Technical Customer Support Specialists who combine technical aptitude, clear communication, and founder-like ownership. If you love solving puzzles, understanding how systems fit together, and making customers feel truly taken care of — you’ll thrive here.



What You’ll Do

* Solve real problems. Investigate and resolve technical issues using critical thinking — not scripts. You’ll dig into product behavior, spot patterns, and guide customers through solutions.

* Understand the system. Learn how each component of a client’s platform works and how it affects the customer journey. You’ll be trusted to connect dots others miss.

* Deliver concierge-level service. Every interaction should feel personal, calm, and confident — whether it’s
, chat, or phone.

* Collaborate with impact. Work directly with product, engineering, and operations teams to surface insights and improve the product itself.

* Document for scale. Turn your learnings into better help docs, FAQs, and internal notes that make the next interaction faster and smarter.

* Thrive under urgency. Manage multiple priorities while staying organized and composed in fast-moving environments.??



What You Bring

* Experience in technical or software support, IT helpdesk, QA, project management, or a related customer-facing technical role (SaaS + BPO experience is a plus).

* Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills — you enjoy figuring out why something broke, not just how to fix it.

* Excellent written and spoken English, with the ability to explain complex ideas simply.

* Naturally empathetic and service-oriented — you take pride in making customers feel heard and supported.

* Comfortable learning new tools, systems, and technologies quickly.?A stable home office setup with reliable internet (minimum 25 Mbps).??



Why Join Flow

* Elite environment. Work alongside global founders and experienced leaders who will challenge and mentor you.

* Continuous growth. You’ll get access to world-class training (including AI), playbooks, and systems that sharpen your communication, product thinking, and leadership skills.

* Stable, long-term role. We build teams that grow with us — many of our tea
mbers have been with Flow since the beginning (10+ years).

* Remote, flexible, and global. You’ll work with clients across the U.S. and Europe while based out of the comforts of your home.



Be part of something bigger. Flow isn’t just a BPO — we’re redefining what offshore excellence looks like.



How to Apply

If this sounds like you — proactive, thoughtful, and driven to make an impact — apply now.?

title: Contract Web Developer (Project-Based)
description:
ABOUT DISPENZA

Dispenza has quickly become one of the largest marketing agencies in the rapidly-growing emerging market of cannabis as it quickly legalizes state by state in the Americas. As the market matures, we are on a mission to help change how the market operates, leaving the more questionable activities done by current market leaders and emerge as the first marketing agency and platform that values our customers while simultaneously delivering business-changing results to our clients.



JOB OVERVIEW

We’re hiring contract web developers for ongoing project-based website builds / conversions (typically 5–10 pages per site). This is not a full-time role - work is assigned per project.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

- Build pages in WordPress using Elementor / Elementor Pro (page builder experience required)

- Build pages in SGEN using its page builder (Elementor-like)

- Convert existing sites/designs into clean, responsive page builds (Figma/PSD/reference site ? live pages)

- Basic setup + polish: mobile responsiveness, spacing/typography consistency, speed-minded builds



TEAM COLLABORATION

- Working alongside project managers to complete tasks as part of the team’s development process.

- Participating in team meetings to discuss project progress and suggest new tools or techniques.



REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- Strong portfolio of live sites (page-build focused)

- Comfortable learning a new builder quickly (SGEN builder is similar to Elementor)

- Detail-oriented, reliable, deadline-driven

- Clear communication (quick updates, asks good questions)



DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- WP builders: WPBakery, Divi (Elementor is primary)

- ACF, CPT, basic theme/plugin troubleshooting

- Shopify ? WordPress migrations or landing page builds



COMPENSATION

Project-based pay (per site / per batch of pages).



SCHEDULE

- 8 hour shift, Tuesday to Saturday, 7:00am to 4:00pm Manila Time.

- Minimal overtime during weekdays and weekends will be expected as part of salary



Dispenza is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, wordpressage, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other basis protected by law.





HOW TO APPLY

- Please fill out the following form in order for your application to be considered: 

- Must complete a paid test task (small page build).

- Passing the test = eligible for ongoing paid projects.



Good luck!

title: ManyChat / Chatbot Implementation Specialist
description:
We are a Chicago-area real estate brokerage and mortgage lending company helping homebuyers,

sellers, and investors across the Chicago Southland and Northwest Indiana. We are looking for a

detail-oriented ManyChat specialist to implement and deploy chatbot flows that we have already

designed.

What You'll Be Doing

• Taking our pre-designed chatbot flows and building them out inside ManyChat 

Messenger, Instagram DM, SMS)

• Setting up triggers, quick replies, conditional logic, and action steps exactly as outlined

• Implementing conversation sequences for mortgage applications, refinance inquiries, home

valuations, seller lead capture, and more

• Connecting ManyChat to our CRM (Follow Up Boss), landing pages (ClickFunnels), and other

tools via Zapier or native integrations

• Testing all flows thoroughly before launch to ensure everything works correctly

• Deploying 
 across our
 pages, Instagram accounts, and SMS campaigns

• Making updates and adjustments to existing flows as directed

• Troubleshooting any technical issues with integrations or flow logic

You're a Great Fit If You Have

• Hands-on experience working inside ManyChat (building flows, setting up automations, connecting

integrations)

• Strong attention to detail — you will be implementing flows exactly as designed, so accuracy

matters

• Experience with Zapier or Make (Integromat) for platform integrations

• Familiarity with CRMs (Follow Up Boss experience is a plus)

• Good English communication skills for team coordination

• Ability to follow instructions precisely while also flagging potential improvements

• Reliable, responsive, and able to meet deadlines

• Bonus: Experience in real estate, mortgage, or financial services

What We Offer

• Consistent, long-term part-time work with a growing company

• All chatbot strategies and flow designs provided — no guesswork

• Opportunity to grow your role as we expand our automation systems

To Apply

Please include the following with your application:

1. A brief summary of your ManyChat experience

2. Screenshots or links to chatbot flows you have built or implemented

3. Your availability and preferred working hours

4. Your hourly rate expectation within the posted range

title: Graphic Designer (Amazon Focused)
description:
Who are we?

Rael is an award-winning, VC-backed clean feminine care and skincare startup with a mission to empower women to make safe, healthy choices for their bodies. Unlike conventional products, Rael products are toxin-free, chlorine-free, fragrance-free, and hypoallergenic—without ever compromising on quality, comfort, or performance.



Founded in 2017 in Southern California by three Korean American women with distinct backgrounds—a journalist and bestselling author, a former Disney movie distributor with a Harvard MBA, and an architect-turned-art director—Rael began with organic cotton cover pads and quickly became the #1 pad brand on Amazon. Today, we’ve expanded into clean feminine care, feminine wellness supplements, and skincare inspired by K-beauty innovation, including pimple patches, facial sheet masks, and everyday skincare essentials. We’re also proud to be the #2 pimple patch brand on Amazon.



Rael products are sold at Amazon, 
, Target, Ulta Beauty, Walmart, CVS, Walgreens, Sprouts, and more. Our brand has been recognized across the industry, earning honors such as Wellness Brand of the Year (Glossy), Best Use of TikTok (Glossy), and multiple best-in-class beauty awards from Allure, Cosmopolitan, and Good Housekeeping, among others. Our CEO has also been recognized as an Entrepreneur of the Year by EY, reflecting Rael’s strong leadership and continued growth.



Rael was named to the Inc. 5000 list in both 2023 and 2024, celebrating the fastest-growing private companies in America, and has grown into a globally recognized brand with a branch office in Seoul, Korea. We’re also proud to be the most-followed and fastest-growing feminine care brand on TikTok, and a top women’s wellness brand trusted and loved by thousands of beauty and wellness influencers.



If you’re passionate about making a meaningful impact, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and want to help shape the future of women’s health and wellness, we’d love for you to join us.



Job Summary:

We’re looking for a passionate and diligent Graphic Designer to join our creative team at Rael, reporting to the Creative Director. The person for this role possesses the ability to work hands-on, conceptually as well as practically. You will work closely with our Senior Graphic Designer and Creative Director on digital projects, focused on executing graphic design for our Amazon business. Projects include copy and image updates, and design for
, ads, social, and website work, with a special focus on mobile design. The right candidate will have an insatiable appetite to create and develop content across a wide variety of platforms and mediums, collaborate with the team, and uphold the quality, and  look and feel Rael’s visual storytelling. 



Most importantly, we hope you share our enthusiasm for our products and the mission that drives us. If you are passionate about what we do and eager to contribute to our cause, we would love to hear from you!



What you will do:

- As a dedicated Amazon designer, focus on Amazon projects such as:

     - Product main and listing image updates 

     - Regulatory updates

     - Image asset updates for various language translations

     - Amazon promotional banner and newsletter assets i.e. Prime Day

     - Storefront, A+ content, and homepage banner refresh updates

     - Virtual bundle images

     - Wireframing to develop consistent visual systems, templates and guidelines 

     - Photo retouching/compositing: realistic product replacement/recomposition  of assortments within existing photography

     - Postcard design

     - Packaging updates

- Support the rest of the Rael business beyond Amazon by executing designs for various digital applications, including listing images,
, ads, website, social media, renderings, product training templates, and promotional collaterals in partnership with marketing and sales

- Ensure that all artworks meet all brief requirements, including correct dimensions, resolution, format, and die-lines

- Follow provided creative direction within existing assets and uphold consistent, high quality, on brand look and feel

- BONUS: Proficiency in packaging design layout and software to make copy changes and export files

- BONUS: Video editing skills, ability to cut and edit existing videos into new versions, dimensions, or formats



What will make you stand out:



Experience

- 3+ years of graphic design experience, in digital and e-commerce; in-house and/or agency

- Ability to work quickly, efficiently, and accurately within all required aspects of the Adobe Creative Suite: Photoshop, Illustrator (BONUS: After Effects, Premiere Pro)

- Obsessed with design principles, precision and holds all work to a high standard

- Dedicated to finding creative solutions to design problems, always considering new visual ways to effectively communicate messages across platforms and channels



Interpersonal

- You take pride in producing accurate, high-quality work and catching the small things that make a big difference

- Comfortable communicating clearly and effectively with tea
mbers at all levels, whether it’s through
, reports, or face-to-face conversations

- You’re skilled at staying organized, meeting deadlines, and getting things done independently without much handholding

- Always ready to pitch in and go the extra mile to support your teammates and help the team succeed



Additional Preferred Experience and Skills

- Expertise in Amazon image strategy and familiar with A/B testing tools such as Amazon Seller Central



Please note this is a full time, contract position meaning you will be paid for the hours worked. We do not offer paid holidays or health benefits. Paid sick or vacation time off will be available to you after 6 months of employment.

title: 100k-150k Are You A PH CPA? WFH US Senior Accountant Position +HMO + 13TH
description:
Get ready, we’re poised to take over the world of accounting –well, almost. Come join our small and agile team as we continue steady growth while having fun in the process. We’re on the move in this fast paced ever changing market as new technology is being birthed at a rapid rate -you adapt or die!



You would be responsible for managing client accounts including direct contact with the clients and their CPAs, reviewing their files for accuracy and completeness before submitting reports. You will also be working directly with client managers and making sure work is completed for them on time and relaying any needs to them if items are needed from clients. Relationship with our clients is paramount so a pleasant friendly personality is a definite asset. You must possess excellent interpersonal skills, value attention to detail, can handle a variety of responsibilities simultaneously, ability to work independently, problem solve and act with foresight.



Our team of accountants is a very hard-working group and anyone who joins the team will be expected to pull their weight. During tax season, our team is expected to be available up to 60 hours per week with overtime pay over 40 hrs per week. However, this is usually only 8-10 times per year. Outside of the busy season, our team works standard 40-hour weeks.



Who We Are:



We exist to help business owners take their attention off their bookkeeping & accounting and focus on running their business! As nerdy as it may sound, we love accounting. The satisfaction that comes from balancing a reconciliation is, well, rewarding to say the least! We have helped many of our clients increase profits and have a better understanding of how to thrive in their field as a result of working closely with them.



We enjoy working as a team and building lasting relationships within our company! We focus on work/life integration and always learning and growing, personally and professionally.



Some of our values include:



Honesty and Trustworthiness

Can do/Get it done attitude

High value for self & others

Team player

Open communication

Positive outlook on life and work

Growing and learning individually & professionally



Who We Work With:



We work with small to medium size businesses in over 20 industries.



Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To:



-Reconciling payroll, cash accounts & balance sheet and maintain supporting documentation (full cycle bookkeeping & accounting)

-Calculate, prepare and file sales tax returns

-Preparing 1099s, send to recipients and clients, e-file with IRS and state agencies

-Payroll - including on-boarding new payroll clients, registering with government agencies, processing payroll and calculating/preparing payroll reports and quarterly returns

-Perform intercompany reconciliations

-Assist with 3rd party financial audits

-Review and prepare journal entries relating to fixed assets, inventory, accruals & deferrals

-Commitment to maintain the highest level of confidentiality while working with client data.

-Willingness to consistently and accurately follow established policies and procedures.

-Perform ad-hoc analysis, research and reports as needed

-Communicate with client CPAs regarding client file and managing necessary communication at tax time

-Work on client files using US GAAP, modified cash basis or cash basis

-Completing work for 5-8 clients files per day on a regular basis and meeting associated deadlines

-On average 40% of work is client contact (including last minute requests)/managing expectations, the other 60% is working in and reviewing files

-Ability to work by yourself a majority of your day and prioritize tasks

-Must have high value for organizing and meeting deadlines and handling multiple projects simultaneously

-Must be adaptable and willing to change with new processes & procedures as we grow

-Must have excellent work habits, including dependability and willingness to work the hours necessary to meet deadlines during seasonal increases in workload

-Assist with the implementation of a new accounting systems & learning new software for clients

-Create and maintain process documentation for each client

-People skills and working with a wide range of client personalities

-Ability to communicate financials and general accounting concepts clearly and effectively to clients

-Solve problems and develop new methods of analysis, identify, and implement process improvements

-Teach other tea
mbers & clients with patience and respect

-Embrace coaching and feedback given to you and implement changes as needed to help meet team and client goals.

-Strong customer service skills with ability to empathize and instill confidence

-24-hour communication. Deal with the
 or phone call request on the same day or advise the client or tea
mber -when you will get back to them.

-If you have informed the client or tea
mber that you will get back to them by day X, ensure that you have done that by the promised date.

-If unable to meet the original target, discuss a new (realistic) deadline with the tea
mber/client that suits their needs.



Qualifications:



Success in this role is partly determined by:

Accuracy of your work

Ability to meet deadlines and work on important as well as urgent tasks

Positive & enthusiastic attitude – solutions focused

Internal Responsiveness to
s & Phone Calls

Cooperation with Tea
mbers

Quality of working papers

Reliability – on time to work and meetings

Following Procedures and systems





Must have as a minimum of:

Be able to start working within 1 month upon acceptance of job offer

You have meticulous attention to detail with the superb organizational skills

Excellent written & spoken English

Experience working nights

Experience working with US clients: 1 year (Preferred)

2 years of full cycle US accounting or related experience (Preferred)

Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance

Must have experience with MS Excel (pivot tables and advanced formulas etc.)

Strong understanding and implementation of GAAP

A quiet and clean place to work and conduct Zoo
etings from, away from distractions

Stable internet connection of at least 5Mbps and a backup of a pocket WiFi or Mobile Data

History of promotion in a similar role

working night shift: 1 year (Preferred)



Mandatory:

You are a genuinely good-hearted person who is FRIENDLY and fun to work with! You enjoy being part of a cohesive team of “drama-free” professionals who are responsible, show up to work regularly and on time, and you take full responsibility for your work. You don’t make excuses, and you own up to your mistakes and realize that all mistakes are learning opportunities that allow you to improve yourself. NO OUTSIDE CLIENTS.



Nice to have:

Strong in QuickBooks Online and QuickBooks Desktop

US Tax experience and/or CPA license is a plus

Experience working for The Big Four accounting firms





Job Type:

Full-Time

Direct Hire

Long Term Position

Hourly Pay Guaranteed 40 Hrs Per Week

Overtime Pay 1.5 X Rate Over 40 Hrs Per Week

Pay Includes Night Shift Differential



Benefits Include:

15 Days Paid Leave Per Year

HMO Plan For You

Reimbursement for OFS PhilHealth

SSS Self Payments

Opportunities For Promotion

Pay Raises

Work From Home

Paid Training

High-end IT devices



Schedule:

8 hour night shift

Mon-Fri 8:00AM - 5:00 PM PST

(Your schedule would follow the 1 hour “Daylight Savings” time change PST)





Resume Submission Instructions:



Earn bonus points and show us your attention to details when sending us your resume. Copy and paste the following address into a new browser and upload your resume:




/u/v65h7mo3n4xh3nus32dhi8





Please name the file using the following format: Last name, First Name, "Resume", Date.





Required: Show off your spoken English skills and record a quick (at least 2 mins) video of yourself telling us why you love accounting and working with clients! Go ahead and upload it along with your resume and please name the files using the format listed above.



*We appreciate all applications, but only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We are an equal opportunity employer. Hiring decisions are administered without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law.



Do you sponsor Visas/require relocation?

We do not offer sponsor visas. We’ll hire great people anywhere across the Philippines, no relocation is required.

title: Real Estate Video Editor (Project-Based, Long-Term Opportunity)
description:
URGENT HIRING – REAL ESTATE VIDEO EDITOR



We are looking for a skilled Real Estate Video Editor to work with us on a project-based basis, with the opportunity to move into a monthly retainer or full-time role as volume grows.



This role is execution-focused. You will be editing real estate walkthrough and promotional property videos using clear references, instructions, and feedback.



About Us:

22Vision is an Australian-founded creative studio working with real estate brands, agencies, and businesses across Australia. We focus on clean, modern, high-performing video content with strong systems, fast turnaround times, and clear communication.



What You’ll Be Doing:

- Editing real estate walkthrough and property promotion videos

- Clean cuts, pacing, stabilisation, and light speed ramps

title: Staffing Representative
description:
Job description:



Job Title: Staffing Representative - Home Health Therapy (Remote, Night Shift)



Location: Work from Home - (U.S. Pacific Standard Time)



About the Company

A List Therapy Group is a California-based provider of in-home physical, occupational, and speech therapy services. We partner with over 300 agencies and hospitals, delivering exceptional patient care through our large network of licensed therapists.



Position Overview

We are hiring a full-time Staffing Representative to work remotely. This role coordinates therapist assignments, manages incoming referrals, updates patient records, and ensures fast, accurate communication with both clinicians and U.S.-based partner agencies. You will also be responsible for problem-solving staffing challenges and maintaining strong professional relationships with our therapists.



Key Duties



• Review and respond to incoming patient referrals in real time.

• Assign therapists based on location, coverage area, and specialty.

• Enter and update patient data in CliniConnects and TherapySync.

• Follow up on pending cases and manage restaffing when needed.

• Send consent forms and required documents to therapists.

• Communicate promptly via WhatsApp, phone, and
.

• Maintain positive working relationships with therapists to encourage engagement and reliability.

• Identify and resolve staffing issues quickly to prevent delays in patient care.

• Maintain accurate records and update rate sheets as needed.



Qualifications



• Experience in home health staffing, healthcare scheduling, or medical coordination preferred.

• Strong English communication skills (written and spoken).

• Proven problem-solving abilities and conflict resolution skills.

• Ability to build and maintain professional relationships with therapists.

• Highly organized, able to multitask, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

• Proficiency with Google Workspace, WhatsApp, and data entry systems.

• Own computer, noise-cancelling headset, and stable internet connection.

• Comfortable using Hubstaff and 
 with a working camera.

• Willing to work night shift: Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM–6:00 PM PST (Philippines time: 12:00 AM–9:00 AM).



Why Join Us



• Competitive pay for remote work.

• Work directly with a U.S.-based healthcare company.

• Supportive, team-focused environment with growth opportunities.



How to Apply



• Please send a short cover letter highlighting your experience relevant to the role you are applying for, and include your answers to the questions below:

     1. How many years of experience do you have working for a home health provider company?

     2. How many years of experience do you have working as a staffing coordinator?



Once received, we will send you a link to a form that you will need to complete.



Applicants who do not fill out this form we send you will NOT be considered for this position!





Thanks

A List Therapy Group

title: Facebook Ads Graphic Designer
description:
fast-growing e-commerce brand scaling through systematic Meta advertising. We need a designer who understands direct response marketing, not just pretty graphics.



What You'll Do:



Create high-volume static ad iterations based on winning competitor concepts

Design scroll-stopping
/Instagram ads that drive sales, not likes

Rapidly test multiple variations of winning angles

Work within our Ferrari Framework creative testing system



Required Skills:



Figma (primary design tool)

Canva (for quick iterations)

Photoshop (image editing)

Claude AI (for copy assistance/workflow)

Portfolio showing direct response ads (not brand/lifestyle work)



Must Have:



Experience analyzing and iterating on competitor static ads

Understanding of direct response principles (hooks, benefits, urgency)

Ability to produce 20-50+ ad variations per week

Fast turnaround time - we test aggressively



You're NOT a Fit If:



You focus on "pretty" over performance

You need hand-holding on every concept

You can't analyze what makes competitor ads work

You take 2+ days per static ad



To Apply:



Share your portfolio (direct response ads ONLY)

Show 3 examples of competitor ad iterations you've created

Explain what makes a static ad scroll-stopping in 2-3 sentences



Looking for someone who moves fast, tests systematically, and understands that ugly ads often outperform beautiful ones.

title: EA & Social Media Manager Real Estate Accounting Firm
description:

inbox, and community moderation)



Role Overview

You will be the CEO’s right hand, combining executive assistant support with social media and

community management. You’ll manage daily content, communication, and calendars across

multiple businesses while using AI tools to repurpose content and increase engagement.



Key Responsibilities



Social Media Management

, Instagram,

LinkedIn; YouTube/shorts or TikTok as needed)

content (podcasts, webinars, Zoom recordings) into short-form clips, carousels, and posts

interactions

 Groups and

members, welcome new members, and respond to basic questions

team, and help keep discussions active and on-topic

communities



CRM & Leads (GoHighLevel)

trigger/monitor automations and follow-ups

correctly to the right workflows

Meetings, Webinars & Zoom

etings, coaching calls, and webinars

s, and uploading replays

to the right folders or communities

s on behalf of the CEO using agreed rules,

templates, and priorities

and prepare basic notes or links for key calls

checklists, and content calendars

mbers, clients, and partners as needed (e.g., sending

Tools You’ll Use

, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube/shorts, OpusClip, CapCut,

Canva, Claude or similar AI tools for scripts and copy

Requirements

Marketing VA, ideally for coaches, agencies, or real estate/online education businesses

s, and community replies

reels/shorts

Claude, ChatGPT, Descript or similar)

environment

 marketing sequences

experience

title: Virtual Clinical Operations Assistant (RN/BSN Preferred) Psychiatry & Mental Health Practice – U.S.-Based
description:
About the Practice:

Casey Mental Health Collaborative is a growing, physician-led outpatient psychiatry practice providing medication management and therapy services across North Carolina. We prioritize high clinical standards, patient-centered care, and efficient, ethical systems.



We are seeking a highly organized Virtual Clinical Operations Assistant to support medication refills, prior authorizations, and medical records workflows. This role is ideal for a nurse or nursing graduate who enjoys structured clinical-administrative work and wants a long-term virtual position with a U.S. mental health practice.



Position Overview:

This is a remote, full-time virtual role combining responsibilities traditionally handled by:



-Medication refill coordination

-Prior authorization processing

-Medical records management



The role does not involve independent clinical decision-making or patient diagnosis, but does require strong clinical judgment, attention to detail, and comfort working within psychiatric workflows under provider direction and communication with patients and pharmacies for clinical clarification.



Core Responsibilities for Medication Refill Management:

-Medication Refills & Pharmacy Coordination

-Process medication refill requests in Valant under provider protocols

-Communicate with pharmacies regarding prescriptions, refill timing, and clarifications

-Track refill status and escalate urgent or complex issues appropriately

-Coordinate patient refill requests and documentation

-Prior Authorizations

-Prepare and submit prior authorizations for psychiatric medications

-Gather clinical documentation required by insurers

-Track authorization status and follow up proactively

-Communicate outcomes to providers and internal staff



Core Responsibilities for Medical Records & Documentation:

-Process medical records requests within required timelines

-Prepare HIPAA-compliant patient summaries for therapy and external provider requests

-Coordinate disability paperwork and insurance audit requests

-Manage faxed records and secure document handling



Core responsibilities for Administrative & Compliance Support:

-Ensure HIPAA compliance in all communications

-Maintain accurate documentation in Valant

-Follow established SOPs for escalation to providers

-Communicate clearly with U.S.-based clinical and administrative teams



Required Qualifications:

- Nursing degree (RN, BSN, or equivalent international nursing degree strongly preferred)

- Experience in a clinical, hospital, or outpatient healthcare setting

- Familiarity with medical terminology and prescription workflows

- Strong written and spoken English communication skills (okay to use AI such as Krisp for accent reduction)

- High attention to detail and ability to follow protocols precisely

- Reliable high-speed internet and private work environment



Strongly Preferred:

-Experience with U.S. healthcare systems

-Prior work with EHR systems (Valant experience is a plus, not required)

-Experience handling prior authorizations or pharmacy coordination

-Background in psychiatry, behavioral health, or primary care



What This Role Is / Is Not

This role is:

-Structured, protocol-driven, and clinically adjacent - TEAM COMMUNICATION IS REQUIRED...AND FUN/AWESOME

-Focused on operational excellence and patient safety

-Long-term and integral to the practice



This role is not:

Independent nursing practice

Clinical decision-making or patient assessment

A short-term or task-based VA role



Schedule & Compensation:

-Full-time, remote (Philippines-based)

-Work hours aligned with U.S. Eastern Time (specific hours to be discussed AND somewhat flexible)

-Competitive compensation based on experience and credentials

-Paid training and clear onboarding process



How to Apply

Please submit:

-Resume or CV

-Brief cover letter explaining your clinical background and interest in virtual psychiatric practice

-Confirmation of nursing degree and year completed

- Please submit your identifying documents to onlinejobs.ph for ID score increase

title: Research-Based Virtual Assistant – Contractor Resources & Bid Research
description:
About Us

We are a growing U.S.-based insurance agency that works closely with contractors across multiple trades, helping them protect and grow their businesses. In addition to insurance, we are building a contractor-focused website designed to make running a construction business easier — from finding bid opportunities to choosing the right software, tools, and services.

We’ve been employing Virtual Assistants in the Philippines for over 8 years and currently work with a team of 20+ VAs. We value long-term relationships, clear systems, and work that actually makes a difference. Our goal is to build useful, practical resources contractors can trust — and we’re looking for the right person to help us do that.

?

Overview

We are looking for a detail-oriented, research-driven Virtual Assistant who can independently find bid opportunities, software tools, and business resources used by contractors — then clearly document and present those findings in a contractor-friendly way.

This role is not data entry. It requires curiosity, critical thinking, and the ability to explain things simply. If you enjoy researching, comparing options, and turning complex information into clear guidance, this role is a great fit.

?

Responsibilities

???? Research & Data Collection

• Find public and private bid opportunities for contractors, including:

• Local, state, and federal bids

• Commercial and private bid platforms

• Research construction-related software and services, including:

• Estimating and takeoff software

• Project management tools

• Accounting and payroll platforms

• CRM systems

• Scheduling tools

• Safety and compliance tools

• Identify industry-specific resources such as:

• Grants

• Associations

• Certifications

• Training programs

• Supplier and vendor tools

?

???? Resource Evaluation

For each tool or resource, determine and document:

• What the tool or resource does

• Price ranges or typical pricing tiers (when exact pricing is unavailable)

• Pros and cons specifically for contractors

• What type of contractor it’s best suited for, based on:

• Trade

• Company size

• Residential vs commercial focus

• Revenue stage

• Clearly flag:

• Entry-level vs advanced tools

• Best options for solo operators vs growing companies

?

?? Content Creation

• Write clear, polished descriptions for publication on our website

• Translate technical or confusing features into plain English contractors understand

• Organize content consistently so contractors can quickly answer:

• “Is this for me?”

• “Is this worth the cost?”

?

???? Organization & Documentation

• Log all findings in shared documents or project management tools

• Maintain clean, structured records so information is easy to update

• Follow standardized templates and formatting guidelines

?

Required Skills & Qualifications

• Strong online research skills — you know how to dig, compare, and verify

• Excellent written English (clarity matters more than fancy language)

• Ability to summarize complex information simply

• High attention to detail

• Comfortable working independently without constant supervision

• Basic understanding of:

• Construction businesses or

• Small business operations

(You do not need to be a contractor, but you must be willing to learn how they think.)

?

Preferred (Nice to Have)

• Experience researching SaaS tools or business software

• Familiarity with construction trades (roofing, plumbing, HVAC, electrical, general contracting, etc.)

• Experience preparing or publishing content for websites

• Prior VA experience in research-heavy roles

?

Tools You May Use

• Google Search and Google Docs

• Spreadsheets (Google Sheets or Excel)

• Project management tools (ClickUp, Notion, or similar)

• Website CMS (training provided if needed)

?

Work Details

• Remote position

• Flexible schedule (results matter more than hours)

• Ongoing work available for the right person

• Paid per hour or per project (to be discussed)

?

VA Benefits

???? Health Insurance – Medical Stipend Program

We provide a Medical Stipend Program that allows you to choose the health insurance plan that best fits your needs.

Why this is better than a one-size-fits-all HMO:

• Choose a plan that fits you or your family

• Select coverage that works with hospitals and clinics near you

• Customize medical, dental, and vision coverage

Program Details:

• Up to 100,000 PHP per year toward your health insurance premium

• Eligible after 90 days of employment

• Annual premium is divided into weekly payments and added to your paycheck

• You may add beneficiaries, as long as total premiums stay within the allowance

• If your chosen plan exceeds the allowance, you simply cover the difference

?

????? Internet Allowance

• PHP 1,500 per month

?

???? Rice Allowance

• PHP 1,000 per month

?

???? 13th Month Pay

• Equivalent to one month’s base pay

• Paid annually on your work anniversary

?

???? Paid Time Off (PTO)

• 1 week paid vacation leave

• 1 week paid family or sick leave

(Use it or lose it — we encourage you to rest and recharge)

?

???? Tuition Reimbursement

• Up to 50,000 PHP per year

• Can be used for your own education or a family member’s educational expenses
