title: Appfolio Accountant - Property Management
description:
About HouseStack

HouseStack is a fast?growing co?living property management company based in Denver, CO. We manage 48 properties (300+ residents) and leverage technology to streamline leasing, accounting, and maintenance operations. Our mission is to deliver a hands?off, high?tech experience for both investors and tenants.



Position Summary

We’re seeking a detail?oriented AppFolio Accountant to join our remote team immediately. You will be responsible for comprehensive financial operations within AppFolio, including reconciliations, billing, expense tracking, and reporting. This role reports to the Director of Operations and collaborates closely with accounting and leasing teams.



Key Responsibilities

AppFolio Accounting

Enter and reconcile rent payments, deposits, and non?rental charges

Generate and distribute owner statements, invoices, and financial reports

Financial Reconciliations

Reconcile multiple bank accounts and credit cards weekly

Investigate and resolve discrepancies promptly

Billing & Expense Tracking

Prepare monthly tenant billing, late?fee assessments, and vendor invoices

Track operating expenses, charge?backs, and owner bill?backs accurately

Reporting & Analysis

Produce monthly P&L, cash?flow, and variance analysis reports

Assist with annual budget preparation and forecasting

Process Improvement

Identify opportunities to automate or streamline workflows

Document and maintain standard operating procedures



Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree (Accounting, Finance, Business) or equivalent work experience

3+ years of hands?on AppFolio experience

Proven experience reconciling multiple bank and credit?card accounts

Strong billing and invoicing background

Excellent Excel skills (pivot tables, VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP)

Detail?oriented with a commitment to accuracy

Strong written and verbal communication skills



Preferred Qualifications

Experience in co?living or multi?family property management accounting

Familiarity with QuickBooks or other accounting software

Comfortable working independently in a fully remote setting

Proactive mindset with an ability to suggest and implement process optimizations



Compensation & Benefits

Competitive monthly contractor rate (please specify your rate in PHP)

Flexible schedule; must overlap at least 2–3 hours per day with Mountain Time (UTC–06:00)

Opportunity for performance bonuses

Professional development budget



Additional Details

Start Date: ASAP

Contract Duration: 6? or 12?month initial engagement, with option to extend

Equipment: Must supply your own laptop

KPIs & Performance Metrics: Reconciliation turnaround time, accuracy rate in financial reports

Probationary Period & Review Cycle: 90?day performance review

Tools & Access Provided: Secure VPN, AppFolio access, Slack channels

Data Security: NDA and data?protection compliance required



How to Apply

Submit your résumé and a brief cover letter via onlinejobs.ph.

In your cover letter, include:

Your hourly rate expectation in PHP

Confirmation of your ability to overlap with UTC–06:00 work hours

Examples of complex reconciliations you’ve handled in AppFolio

title: Product Luister
description:
Job Overview

We are a fast-growing dropshipping ecommerce company looking for an experienced Shopify Product Lister to join our team. This role is STRICTLY NOT FOR BEGINNERS.

We manage multiple Shopify stores and move quickly, so we’re looking for someone who is extremely detail-oriented, reliable, and capable of handling high-volume product listings with accuracy and speed. If you take pride in clean, error-free work and can operate with minimal supervision, this role is for you.

Responsibilities

• Create, edit, and upload high-quality product listings on Shopify

• Accurately input product titles, descriptions, variants, pricing, images, tags, and collections

• Ensure consistency and organization across multiple Shopify stores

• Follow internal systems, SOPs, and instructions precisely

• Double-check all listing details — accuracy is non-negotiable

• Work efficiently while maintaining high standards of quality

• Identify and fix listing issues proactively

• Use sound judgment and initiative to help improve store performance

• Adapt quickly to new tools, workflows, and instructions

Requirements

title: Business Acquisition Origination Assistant
description:
Business Acquisition Origination Assistant 





•part-time



•work from home



•remote in the Philippines



•experience required





This is a new position for our growing small company which will play a crucial, front-end role in mergers and acquisitions (M&A). The focus will be on identifying and initiating relationships with potential business acquisition targets. This role is essential for driving proprietary deal flow —finding potential business for sale before they hit the open market. 





Key Responsibilities:



•Identification & Research: 



Research industries and local markets to identify potential businesses to acquire while focusing on lower middle-market opportunities. Must be familiar with business listing databases and come with recommendations. 



•Direct Outreach (Sourcing): Contacting, educating, and initiating relationships with business owners, often conducting cold messaging on LinkedIn and
ing outreach to find targets.



•Data Management & CRM: Maintaining databases, tracking KPIs, and ensuring accurate documentation of outreach efforts.



•Initial Evaluation & Due Diligence Support: Assessing business potential and supporting senior professionals in early-stage deal structuring and evaluation. 







Required Skills and Qualifications:



•Communication & Interpersonal Skills: Excellent written English proficiency and ability to build rapport with business owners through LinkedIn, and cold outreach
. 



•Entrepreneurial Mindset: self-starter attitude with a focus on business development and “owning” their deal pipeline.







Background requirements

•1+ years of experience in sales, financial services, or M&A. 







Role Type: This is a high-autonomy, high-expectation role that acts as the starting point for deal flow.

title: Google Business Profile Optimization Sprint - Medicare Insurance Agency (1-Week Project)
description:
This is a 7-day sprint project to rapidly optimize our Google Business Profile and test if we work well together.

We're a Medicare insurance agency in Florida (Pinellas, Hillsborough, Manatee, Pasco counties). We need our GBP transformed from inactive to optimized and posting-ready—FAST.

If you crush this sprint, we'll immediately offer ongoing work (GBP management + lead research, 20-30 hrs/week).



Project Scope: 7 Days

Day 1-2: Audit & Optimize



Audit current GBP listing(s), flag any duplicates

Optimize business description (we provide compliance-approved copy)

Add all service areas (4 FL counties)

Upload 10 photos minimum (office, team, service area—we provide or you source stock)

Set up Q&A section with 6 common Medicare questions (we approve answers)

Deliverable: Optimization checklist completed, before/after screenshots



Day 3-5: Content Creation



Create 6 GBP posts ready to publish



Topics: AEP deadlines, turning-65 checklist, Medicare basics, local senior resources

We provide topic list + compliance rules





Design 3 simple Canva graphics (or use stock images)

Deliverable: 6 posts drafted in Google Doc for approval



Day 6: Launch & Templates



Publish first 2 approved posts

Create 30-day content calendar (post topics + schedule)

Write 3 review response templates (positive, negative, neutral)

Deliverable: Posts live, calendar + templates in shared folder



Day 7: Report & Handoff



Pull baseline insights (if available—may be limited data)

Document what was done + recommendations for next 90 days

Record 5-min Loom walkthrough of GBP setup

Deliverable: Final report + handoff video





Final Deliverables (End of Day 7):

? Fully optimized GBP (description, photos, services, hours, categories, Q&A)

? 6 compliance-approved posts (2 published, 4 ready to schedule)

? 30-day content calendar (topics mapped to dates)

? 3 review response templates

? Recommendations doc (next steps for local SEO)

? 5-min Loom handoff video (walking through everything you did)



What You'll Need:

? Proven GBP experience (show 1-2 profiles you've managed—must have examples)

? Available 3-4 hours/day for 7 consecutive days (20-25 hours total)

? Fast executor (this is a sprint, not a slow burn)

? Fluent written English (posts must be perfect—no grammar errors)

? Understands compliance (healthcare/insurance = regulated language)

? Comfortable with Canva (basic graphics for posts)

? Responsive communication (check Slack/WhatsApp 2x daily minimum)



What We Provide:

? GBP login access (via Google Workspace)

? Brand assets (logo, colors, photos)

? Compliance guidelines (1-page doc of do's/don'ts)

? Content topic list (80+ topics pre-researched)

? Daily check-ins (15 min Zoom or async via Loom)

? Fast approval turnaround (we review your work within 4 hours)

title: Senior Blockchain & Trading Systems Engineer (Web Platform)
description:
Project Overview



We are building a web-based crypto trading signal platform that delivers real-time trading signals to users. The system currently exists as a Windows desktop application, and the goal is to re-architect and migrate it into a scalable, secure, and high-performance web application.



The platform processes live market data, applies trading logic and indicators, and distributes actionable signals with low latency to traders operating across multiple exchanges.



Key Responsibilities



Design and develop a web-based trading application that mirrors and extends the functionality of the existing Windows trading system



Implement real-time data pipelines for crypto market data (price feeds, order books, indicators, volume, volatility)



Build and optimize signal generation engines for crypto trading strategies



Develop low-latency communication layers using WebSockets, streaming APIs, or message queues



Integrate with centralized and decentralized crypto exchanges (REST / WebSocket APIs)



Architect scalable backend services capable of handling high-frequency market updates



Ensure data integrity, fault tolerance, and high availability for live trading signals



Implement authentication, authorization, and role-based access control for users



Apply security best practices for crypto-related systems (API key handling, encryption, rate limiting)



Collaborate on system design for future automation, including bot execution and portfolio tracking



Required Technical Skills



Core Technologies



Strong experience with web application development (React, Next.js, or similar frameworks)



Backend expertise with Node.js, Python, or similar high-performance server runtimes



Real-time communication using WebSockets, SSE, or streaming protocols



Blockchain & Trading

title: Senior Frontend Game & Blockchain Engineer (Web3 Puzzle Platform)
description:
Project Overview



We are enhancing an existing image-based puzzle application by significantly upgrading its visual animations, rendering performance, and interactive effects, while also integrating blockchain-based features to enable digital ownership, rewards, and on-chain interactions.



The project combines high-performance 2D rendering (game-engine style) with Web3 infrastructure, creating a modern, visually engaging puzzle platform that bridges casual gaming and blockchain technology.



Key Responsibilities



Game & Animation Development

Migrate or enhance rendering using Pixi.js, Phaser.js, or comparable 2D rendering frameworks



Optimize render loops, asset loading, and memory usage for smooth gameplay across devices



Implement advanced effects such as transitions, particle systems, shader-based effects, and dynamic lighting



Ensure responsive interaction handling (drag, snap, inertia, zoom, touch support)



Blockchain & Web3 Integration



Design and integrate blockchain-based features into the puzzle platform



Implement wallet connectivity (e.g., MetaMask or WalletConnect)



Develop smart contract interactions for game logic, rewards, or asset ownership

Integrate on-chain/off-chain synchronization between gameplay state and blockchain data



Apply security best practices for Web3 applications



Platform & Architecture



Collaborate on the overall web architecture to combine real-time rendering with Web3 services



Integrate backend services for user profiles, progress tracking, and metadata storage



Ensure scalability and maintainability for future content, modes, and monetization features



Required Technical Skills



Frontend & Rendering



Strong JavaScript / TypeScript expertise



Hands-on experience with Pixi.js, Phaser.js, or similar rendering/game frameworks



Deep understanding of canvas, WebGL, rendering pipelines, and animation loops



Experience optimizing FPS, draw calls, textures, and asset pipelines



Blockchain & Web3



Solid understanding of blockchain fundamentals (transactions, wallets, gas, confirmations)



Experience integrating Web3 libraries (ethers.js, web3.js, or similar)



Familiarity with smart contracts (Solidity or equivalent)



Understanding of NFT standards and token-based systems



General Web Stack



Experience with modern frontend frameworks (React, Next.js, or similar)



API integration (REST / GraphQL)



Version control with Git and collaborative workflows



Preferred / Bonus Skills



Experience building browser-based games or interactive applications



Knowledge of game physics, easing functions, and animation curves



Familiarity with DeFi, tokenomics, or on-chain reward systems



Experience with cross-platform optimization (desktop, mobile, tablet)



UI/UX sensitivity for game feel and player engagement



Project Goals



Modernize the puzzle app with smooth, engaging, game-quality animations



Introduce blockchain-enabled ownership and reward mechanics



Build a scalable foundation for future game modes, tournaments, and digital assets



Ideal Candidate Profile



Strong frontend engineer with game development instincts



Comfortable balancing performance-critical rendering with Web3 logic



Passionate about interactive design, animation, and blockchain gaming



Able to evolve an existing product into a polished Web3-enabled experience

title: Product Operations Manager (Bubble)
description:
Company: Conserva Care

Location: Remote (Must work according to Eastern Standard/Daylight Time)

Schedule: Full-time, Monday–Friday, 11 AM–8 PM EST/EDT

Type: Contractor



About Conserva Care



Conserva Care is a solar system service and maintenance technology platform that connects residential solar system owners with certified contractors for inspections, cleanings, repairs, warranty claims, and ongoing system health monitoring.



Our internal platform is built on Bubble and supports high-volume, image-heavy workflows, complex operational logic, and data-driven inspection reporting.



We operate across multiple U.S. states and are scaling rapidly. We are now looking for a Product Operations Manager to own execution and delivery.





Role Overview

This is an execution-first, Bubble-native Product Operations role.

You will not be responsible for high-level product vision or user discovery. Instead, your mission is to translate architectural direction into clear, actionable work for developers and ensure consistent, predictable delivery across multiple concurrent initiatives.



You will act as the operational backbone of our product development process.





Key Responsibilities



Delivery & Execution

Own sprint planning, backlog grooming, and task prioritization across multiple Bubble initiatives.

Break down high-level architectural designs into:

- clear tickets

- scoped backend workflows

- well-defined data model changes

 -Ensure developers always have a full, prioritized queue of work



Developer Enablement

Serve as the primary point of contact for Bubble developers.

Remove blockers and ambiguity before work begins.

Ensure requirements are complete before development starts.

Coordinate closely with the Bubble Tech Lead on implementation details.



Cross-Project Coordination

Manage multiple parallel workstreams without losing velocity.

Track dependencies across features, refactors, and performance initiatives.

Ensure architectural guardrails are followed during execution.



Quality & Consistency

Enforce standards for:

- data modeling

- privacy rules

- backend workflow organization

- naming conventions and documentation

Validate that delivered work aligns with requirements before release.



Operational Rigor

Maintain sprint boards, documentation, and delivery timelines.

Provide clear status updates and risk visibility to leadership.

Identify execution bottlenecks and propose process improvements.



What This Role Is Not

Not a UX-heavy product discovery role.

Not a Figma-driven design role.

Not a junior or learning-on-the-job Bubble role.

Not a role that requires the CTO to micromanage tasks.





Required Experience & Skills (Non-Negotiable)

2–4+ years of hands-on Bubble experience in production environments.

Proven experience managing Bubble developers on live, scaling applications.

Deep understanding of:

- Bubble data structures & performance implications

- Backend workflows and workload unit (WU) optimization

- Privacy rules and access control

- Experience managing multiple projects simultaneously

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Highly organized, detail-oriented, and execution-focused.





Strongly Preferred Qualifications

Prior experience working with:

- Xano or external APIs

- File handling / image-heavy applications

- No-code or low-code scaling challenges

- Field services platforms

- Marketplaces

-  Operations-heavy products





What Success Looks Like (First 90 Days)

Developers operate with minimal day-to-day questions.

Sprints are predictable and consistently delivered.

CTO is no longer managing task-level execution.

Architectural initiatives are executed cleanly and on time.

Bubble performance and scalability work is actively progressing.





Why This Role Matters

This role is critical to Conserva Care’s ability to scale. You will be directly responsible for enabling our engineering team to move faster, cleaner, and with fewer architectural mistakes — while freeing up leadership to focus on long-term platform design.





Compensation

Competitive salary based on experience.

Long-term growth opportunity within a scaling technology company.





Next Steps

If you’re a Bubble expert who thrives on execution, structure, and shipping high-quality work at scale, we want to hear from you.

title: Copy Editor + Fact-Checker for Leadership Book (Chicago Manual Style)
description:
Hi! My name is Seth, and I need the "write" person for the job.



Find out more about me here: 





I'm seeking a meticulous copy editor and fact-checker for a 54,000-word leadership book manuscript scheduled for traditional publication.

Your responsibilities:



Copy Editing (Chicago Manual of Style, 17th edition)



Correct grammar, punctuation, and mechanics

Ensure footnote formatting precision (true footnotes, not endnotes)

Eliminate AI-generated language patterns (excessive hedging, rhythmic sameness, overuse of colons/semicolons)

Maintain voice consistency against reference text (provided)

Flag unclear phrasing for 9th-grade readability without oversimplifying

Use Track Changes to suggest more effective phrasing where appropriate

Ensure consistency across all propositional statements (no internal contradictions in claims, arguments, or data)



Fact-Checking



Verify all citations against original sources (academic journals, books)

Flag unsupported claims or overgeneralizations

Identify contested research presented as settled fact

Check accuracy of statistics, dates, quotes, and attributions

Note missing sources for empirical claims

Cross-check propositional claims across chapters for logical consistency



Book context: Nonfiction leadership book applying mortality awareness research to executive transitions. Heavy emphasis on Terror Management Theory, death reflection studies, and social psychology. Target audience: C-suite executives, founders, board members.



Required qualifications



Proven Chicago Manual of Style expertise (provide samples)

Experience with academic/business nonfiction

Demonstrated fact-checking or research verification background

Native or near-native English proficiency

Familiarity with social science research preferred

Strong logical reasoning skills for detecting contradictions

Proficiency with Microsoft Word Track Changes



CRITICAL APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (read carefully)



Subject line for your application MUST be exactly: "CHICAGO-VERIFY-2026"

Any other subject line = automatic rejection (tests attention to detail)

In your application, you MUST include:



Portfolio with 2+ Chicago-style editing samples (academic or business nonfiction)

Brief explanation (3-4 sentences) of your fact-checking process for (academic) sources

Answer these exact questions: "What is one key difference between the Chicago footnote style and the APA in-text citation?" "How do you (or don't you) use AI in your job as an editor? How has that evolved?" "Who is your favorite author?"

Describe one time you caught a logical contradiction between two statements in a document you edited



Work process



Paid trial: 3 hours on 10-15 pages to assess fit

If trial successful: Full manuscript edit (estimated 25-35 hours)

Deliverables: Marked-up manuscript (Track Changes) + separate memo flagging factual concerns and any logical inconsistencies

Communication via
 and Google Docs



Timeline: Complete within 2-3 weeks of hire

Applications missing the exact subject line, Chicago samples, or the answered questions will be automatically rejected.



WAGE/SALARY

Competitive rate based on experience (discuss during interview)

title: eBay Product Listing Specialist (Part-Time, Remote – Philippines)   Hands-On. Detail-Driven. Built to Grow.
description:
eBay Listing Specialist (High-Value Batch Gig – Philippines)

Hands-On. Detail-Driven. High Payout for High Performance.



Stellar Thrift is a West Coast U.S. company specializing in vintage clothing and rare collectibles. We are growing fast and looking for elite, detail-oriented Listing Specialists in the Philippines for high-value, batch-based work.



     The "Stellar Batch" System



This is a project-based "gig" structure. We currently have a dedicated team of listers, and we manage our workflow through a performance-first priority system.



• The Batch: You are assigned a set volume of listings to complete.



• The Timeline: You have a maximum of 10 days to finish the batch with 100?curacy.



• Weekly Selection: New batches are sent out weekly. These offers are prioritized and sent to our top performers first.



• Availability: We do not guarantee work 24/7. Your workload is directly tied to your effort, high-quality output, and the speed of your previous batch.



     Compensation & Fast Payouts



• Standard Gig Payout: $150.00 USD per completed batch.



• Immediate Approval-Based Pay: We do not make you wait for a specific "payday." Payment is issued via Wise payment app/site immediately after the entire batch has been processed, reviewed, and approved for compliance.



• Speed & Dedication Bonus: For our top-tier workers, we offer bonus scaling for completing batches earlier than the 10-day deadline without sacrificing quality.



• Elite Access: Priority access to the weekly rotation is a privilege earned by our most reliable workers.



     Your Role



• Product Research: Identify vintage brands, era-specific tags (90s/Y2K), and market value.



• Accurate Drafting: Build eBay listings that sell, focusing on condition, measurements, and brand voice.



• Self-Managed: You are responsible for hitting your deadline without being micromanaged.



     Integrity & Rules



• No "Task-Farming": You must do the work yourself. Outsourcing to others or using unauthorized "auto-bots" results in immediate termination.



• Communication: You must be "coachable, teachable, and reachable."



     Who You Are



• Cultural Fluency: You must have a deep understanding of American culture (brands, sports, movies, and trends).



• Language Mastery: You must have strong command of the English language to write compelling and accurate descriptions.



• Prior eBay Experience: This is a must.



• A "Collector’s Eye": You understand why a specific vintage shirt or toy is valuable.



• Setup: Reliable internet and a distraction-free, dedicated workspace.



---



     How to Apply



If you are ready to earn $150 per gig and prove you deserve a spot in our weekly rotation, message us with the subject line: "Stellar High Five"

title: UI/UX Designer — macOS Desktop App (Figma) + App Icon & Branding
description:
I'm building a macOS desktop application called Rediscover — a preset manager for music producers. It helps producers browse, search, preview, and organize their synthesizer preset libraries across multiple plugins, all in one place.

The app is fully functional but currently uses default/placeholder UI. I need a skilled designer to create a polished, professional visual identity and UI design that feels native to macOS while standing out as a premium music production tool.

What You'll Design

Phase 1 — Branding & App Icon



App icon (macOS format, all required sizes from 16x16 to 1024x1024)

Color palette (primary, secondary, accent, backgrounds)

Typography choices (or confirmation of system fonts)

Brand style guide (1–2 pages covering the above)



Phase 2 — Full UI Redesign



Main application window (three-column layout: sidebar, content table, detail panel)

All component states (hover, selected, active, disabled, empty, loading)

Light mode and dark mode variants

Filter bar, search field, dropdown menus

Status bar with playback indicator and controls

Sidebar navigation with sections, user-created lists

Preset detail panel with metadata, actions, and tags

Empty states, loading states, error states

Any micro-interactions or transitions you recommend



Deliverables



Figma file with organized frames, components, and a clear layer structure

Exported assets: app icon (all sizes), any custom icons or graphics as SVG/PDF

Style guide page within Figma or as a separate PDF

Design should be implementation-ready with clear spacing, sizing, and color specs



What I'll Provide You



A detailed design brief document describing every screen, component, and user flow

Wireframe descriptions of the current layout

List of supported synths and sample data

Reference apps for aesthetic direction

Access to ask me questions throughout the project



Ideal Candidate



Strong portfolio showing macOS or desktop app design (not just mobile or web)

Experience with Figma (required)

Understanding of macOS Human Interface Guidelines (native feel)

Bonus: familiarity with music production software aesthetics (DAWs, plugin UIs)

Bonus: experience designing dark-mode-first interfaces

Good communication and ability to work from a written brief



Timeline



Phase 1: 5–7 days from start

Phase 2: 10–14 days from Phase 1 approval

Total project: ~3 weeks



How to Apply

Please include:



Link to your portfolio (Behance, Dribbble, or personal site)

2–3 examples of desktop/macOS app designs you've done (if available)

Your fixed price quote for the full project

Estimated timeline

A brief note on how you'd approach designing a music production tool



Please do not apply if you only have mobile or web design experience. macOS desktop design has different patterns and conventions.

title: Fullstack Web Developer
description:
We are looking for a Full-Stack Web Developer with solid experience in Laravel and Vue.js to help build, maintain, and improve modern web applications. You’ll work closely with designers, product managers, and other developers to deliver features that are clean, scalable, and user-friendly.



This role is ideal for someone who enjoys working across the stack, values readable code, and understands that software is never “done”—only iteratively improved.



Responsibilities

Develop and maintain web applications using Laravel on the back end and Vue.js on the front end

Build RESTful APIs and integrate them with Vue.js components

Implement authentication, authorization, and role-based access control

Work with databases (MySQL/PostgreSQL), including migrations and query optimization

Translate UI/UX designs into responsive, functional interfaces

Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code

Debug issues, fix bugs, and improve application performance

Collaborate with team members through code reviews and planning sessions

title: Content Writer
description:
Job Title: Content Writer



Experience: 1+ Years

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-time



Job Overview



We are seeking a talented and creative Content Writer with a passion for storytelling and an ability to produce engaging and high-quality content. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of content marketing strategies and a knack for writing across various formats to cater to diverse audiences.



Key Responsibilities



Create compelling, clear, and original content for blogs, articles, social media posts, website pages,
 campaigns, and other digital platforms.

Conduct in-depth research on industry-related topics to develop content ideas that resonate with the target audience.

Optimize content for SEO to improve organic reach and engagement.

Collaborate with marketing, design, and development teams to ensure consistency in tone and branding.

Edit and proofread content for accuracy, grammar, and style consistency.

Track content performance metrics and suggest improvements to enhance results.

Stay updated with industry trends and incorporate them into content strategies.

Qualifications and Skills



Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Communications, Marketing, or a related field.

Proven 1+ years of professional content writing experience.

Strong command of English with exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills.

Familiarity with content management systems (e.g., WordPress).

Understanding of SEO principles and best practices.

Ability to adapt writing style to suit different audiences and platforms.

Strong organizational and time-management skills to handle multiple projects and deadlines.

Knowledge of analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics) is a plus.



Job Type: Full-time/Remote

title: Video Editor - Ongoing Work
description:
I am a content creator seeking a skilled and reliable video editor for long-term freelance collaboration. This is fully remote work with regular assignments and opportunity for steady volume. 



Key Responsibilities:



Full-Length Video Editing

Organize and edit raw footage into polished videos, typically 20–50+ minutes (longer preferred). Sequence clips correctly, make precise cuts, apply effects and watermarks where required.



Create engaging trailers with sourced music (examples provided), 10-minute preview versions, short clips, and still snapshots for promotional use.



Export finals in multiple versions: clean (no watermark) + 2 watermarked variants (adjust opacity and positioning to keep key content visible).



Short Promo Edits

Produce dynamic 30-second promotional videos from provided raw clips — incorporating cuts, transitions, effects, and music overlays.



Occasionally create captioned still images from video frames for advertising purposes.



Content Organization & Uploads

Maintain an organized Google Drive database: create properly named folders, upload all edited videos, clips, snapshots, and related documents. Use color-coding to track progress (e.g., red = incomplete, grey = ready, pink = posted).

Upload and schedule preview videos to specified platforms (accounts provided), including any accompanying documentation as required.



Current & Ongoing Workload:  

~14 full-length videos queued for editing  

~15 additional videos for review, partial re-edits, or updates  

~5 short promo clips

This is an active, recurring role with consistent new projects.



Requirements:  Strong experience with professional editing software (e.g., Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, Final Cut Pro — please specify your primary tools)  



Excellent file management and organizational skills  

Ability to source royalty-free music and apply creative trailer/ promo techniques  



High attention to detail, clean cuts, and timeline efficiency  



Reliable communication and ability to meet agreed deadlines  



Secure handling of files and credentials (we provide platform logins)



Nice to Have:  

Experience creating trailers, teasers, or social/promotional edits  



Familiarity with cloud-based workflows (Google Drive organization & uploads)  



Fast turnaround on medium-to-long form content



Compensation is per project/video (or hourly, depending on experience and mutual agreement).  



To apply, please send:  



Your portfolio or showreel (SFW samples welcome)

  

Relevant editing experience summary  



Typical turnaround time for a 30–40 minute edited video  



Your preferred rate structure



Looking to build a long-term working relationship with someone who takes pride in high-quality edits and organization. Excited to hear from you!

title: Growth Marketing Manager (Ads, Funnels & Content) – GoHighLevel
description:
UK Business: ProSkin Clinic & Health UK



PLEASE READ CAREFULLY BEFORE APPLYING



This is not an admin role and not a scheduling-only social media job.



We are hiring an experienced, hands-on growth marketer who can create marketing plans AND execute them, including content creation, paid ads, funnels, and automations, to generate real leads and bookings.



INITIAL CORE FOCUS (Month 1): Tattoo Removal



We focus on one service at a time to ensure speed and measurable results.



Once systems are proven, focus will rotate through:



- Laser Hair Removal

- Skin Treatments

- Lesion Removal



We do not dilute focus. We scale what works.



CORE 4 MARKETING PLAN (REQUIRED)



You will create and document a marketing plan for each CORE service, starting with Tattoo Removal.



Each plan must include:



- Target audience

- Primary offer & messaging

- Funnel structure (GoHighLevel)

- Paid ads strategy

- Content themes & hooks (Reels + posts)

- Photo & video asset requirements



No plan = no execution.



CONTENT CREATION & SOCIAL MEDIA (HANDS-ON)



You will personally create and publish content, including:



- Instagram Reels (editing in CapCut or similar)

- Carousels & posts in Canva

- Hooks, captions, and CTAs

- Repurposing across Instagram &



If you do not create content yourself, do not apply.



MONTHLY PHOTO & VIDEO SHOT LIST (REQUIRED)



Each month you must submit a Photo & Video Shot List aligned to the marketing plan (Reels / Ads / Funnels / Website).

We support filming, you own planning and direction.



GOHIGHLEVEL FUNNELS & AUTOMATIONS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)



- Build landing pages and funnels in GoHighLevel

- Set up lead automations (instant response, follow-ups)

- Manage pipelines and tagging

- Document funnels and automations clearly



If you do not have GoHighLevel experience, do not apply.



PAID ADS (META)



- Launch and manage
 & Instagram ads

- Write conversion-focused ad copy

- Test creative angles

- Optimise weekly using data

- Track CPL, conversion rate, and lead quality



REPORTING & OWNERSHIP



- Weekly performance reporting

- Clear explanation of numbers (spend, leads, CPL, bookings, actions taken)

- Proactive communication

- Performance measured via a monthly scorecard from Day 1



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE



- GoHighLevel (funnels + automations)

- Meta Ads Manager

- Canva + CapCut (hands-on content creation)

- Conversion copywriting

- Service-based businesses



Beginners or trainees will not be considered.



DO NOT APPLY IF



- You have no GoHighLevel experience

- You don’t create Reels or posts yourself

- You can’t explain CPL or optimisation decisions

- You dislike accountability and reporting



HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)



Apply ONLY via this Google Form

(applications via messages will not be reviewed):







You must include proof of work and a 2–4 minute Loom video. Applications without Loom/proof will not be reviewed.

title: Account Executive
description:
NOW HIRING: Virtual Assistant Account Executive

High Valley Enterprises | Remote (Philippines-Based Preferred)



High Valley Enterprises is growing, and we’re looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant Account Executive based in the Philippines to support our roofing and restoration operations. This role is ideal for someone who is experienced, proactive, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment where accuracy, communication, and follow-through matter.



This position supports a U.S.-based team operating on Mountain Standard Time (MST). Candidates should be willing and able to work hours that substantially overlap with MST business hours. While this will require night shift hours in the Philippines, there is some flexibility. The full 8-hour shift does not have to perfectly align with MST; if it works well, the final 2–3 hours of the shift may be worked after 5:00 PM MST.



HOURS OFFERED:

• 30–40 hours per week depending on seasonal workload fluctuation

• Busy season is typically March–November, with the highest demand for hours during this time



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Conventional estimating

• Xactimate estimating (required)

• Insurance supplementation support

• Invoice preparation and collections follow-up

• Basic bookkeeping tasks

• Product and material research

• Job reconciliation and cost tracking

• Cost control support across projects

• Event coordination and organizing

• Customer follow-up calls for quality assurance

• Requesting and managing online reviews



REQUIREMENTS:

• Required: Proven experience using Xactimate for estimating

• Required: Minimum 2 years of construction industry experience

• Roofing industry experience is a strong bonus

• Strong English communication skills (written and verbal)

This role plays an important part in keeping our jobs accurate, organized, and running smoothly from start to finish while helping us maintain strong customer relationships.

title: Real Estate Closing/Listing Coordinator

mbers who want CRG to be their sole employer.



Who We’re Looking For:

We are only considering candidates with at least one (1) year of residential real estate experience.

The ideal candidate is a Virtual Professional who has worked as a Transaction Coordinator/Listing Coordinator for a Realtor or real estate team, preferably in Texas and ideally with Keller Williams. Experience with Realtors in other states will be considered; however, familiarity with Texas real estate documents is a strong plus.

Why Work With Cain Realty Group?

Full-time, long-term opportunity

Clear growth potential within the company

Health insurance reimbursement after 6 months

Annual performance reviews with raise eligibility

Proven systems, models, and training

CRG has successfully worked with Virtual Professionals for over 6 years. We are not experimenting—we have a proven track record of helping our VPs thrive and build stable, long-term careers.



Role Overview:

This position requires a highly organized, service-oriented professional with excellent time-management skills and strong attention to detail. You will provide administrative support to our Account Managers, allowing them to focus on consistent, high-quality communication with clients. Minimum of 1 year residential real estate experience

Professional references with phone numbers

(We will speak directly with prior employers;
-only references will not be accepted.)

Current, valid NBI clearance prior to start date



If you are an experienced real estate Virtual Professional seeking a stable, full-time role with a team that truly invests in its people, we encourage you to apply.



A few of our group's most commonly used affirmations and mottos are below:

-Get comfortable being uncomfortable

-The only way to grow is to change

-Keep your emotions between the lines

-BE DO HAVE



Primary Objectives

-Manage listings alongside the Account Manager through the contract

-Keep the Agents and Account Managers informed regarding any problems or issues that need to be handled

Regular Work Activities

-System development, implementation, and management

-Information management

-Oversight of contracts and listings

-Regular, effective communication with Agents and Account Managers

-Coordinate various pre-listing activities for our home selling clients



Key Skills

-Strong written communication skills

-Exceptional organizational and project management abilities

-Great ability to focus

-Concerned about doing things the right way

-Calm under pressure

-Learning-based

Systems Used

-Mailchimp



People Contacts and Interactions

Work Schedule (5 days / week)

title: WEBSITE DEVELOPER/DESIGNER
description:
About Lush Esthetica

Lush Esthetica is a modern cosmetic clinic focused on results-driven treatments, safety, and professionalism. All treatments are performed by trained professionals, and our brand is positioned as modern, refined, and premium — clean aesthetics with strong credibility.



We are looking for a website designer who understands modern web design trends and can combine them with strategic conversion thinking to create a website that doesn’t just look good, but drives bookings and sales.



The Role

You will design and build Lush Esthetica’s new website with a strong focus on modern, minimal, and high-end design, while structuring the site strategically to guide visitors toward action.

This role requires someone who thinks beyond visuals — someone who understands user behaviour, trust-building, and conversion optimisation in a competitive aesthetic industry.



Key Responsibilities

Design and develop a modern, clean, and high-end website aligned with the Lush Esthetica brand

Create a strategic site structure focused on conversions, bookings, and lead generation

Apply modern UX/UI principles with clear hierarchy, whitespace, and intuitive navigation

Implement strong CTAs, trust signals, and social proof in a non-salesy, premium way

Ensure a seamless mobile-first experience

Optimise for fast load times, SEO-friendly structure, and performance

Collaborate on content structure and messaging to maximise clarity and conversions

Integrate booking systems, contact forms, and analytics if needed



What We’re Looking For

Proven experience creating modern, conversion-focused websites

Strong understanding of sales psychology and user journeys

Ability to justify design choices based on conversion and UX principles

Clean, minimal, and contemporary design style

Experience with Webflow, WordPress, Shopify, or similar platforms

Independent, structured, and detail-oriented



Nice to Have

Experience within the aesthetic, beauty, or medical industry

Knowledge of SEO, CRO, or analytics tools

Understanding of brand positioning for premium services

What Success Looks Like

A modern, high-end website that reflects trust and professionalism

Clear messaging that instantly communicates value

Strategic CTAs that naturally guide users to book or enquire

A scalable website structure that supports long-term growth



How to Apply

Please include:

A short introduction

Portfolio examples of modern websites with conversion focus

A brief explanation of how you approach design + strategy for conversions

title: AI Video Animator Needed (Kling, Sora, Veo) to Create 20 to 30 Second Cartoon Style Ad
description:
Overview



I am hiring an experienced AI video creator to produce a short, horizontal animated advertisement (20 to 30 seconds). The concept is an ultrasound 
nt that transitions into a fast montage of a child’s future life 
nts, ending with on screen text: “FREE ULTRASOUND.”



This is not basic prompting. I need someone who can maintain character consistency, match a clean Pixar style cartoon look, generate multiple scenes, animate them smoothly, and edit into one polished clip.



Style Reference



- The style is a warm, high quality 3D cartoon look similar to the reference discussed in the
 thread.



Video Specs



- Orientation: Horizontal (landscape) for future use on large displays (billboards).

- Length: 20 to 30 seconds total.

- Deliverable: One final MP4 video file.



Scene Scope (what needs to be shown)



The core sequence is:



- Doctor touches mother’s belly while ultrasound is being done.

- Transition into a montage of the child’s future, similar to the referenced stork style ad but with the doctor and ultrasound concept.



Example montage 
nts requested (I have example scenes):



- Childhood 
nts like dad reading a story, mom teaching the child to write, riding a bike with dad.

- Kid sports 
nt (soccer).

- Teen stage (visually older than the child scenes).

- Graduation.

- Career 
nt (welder or office job type scene).

- Marriage (wedding).

- End card text: FREE ULTRASOUND.



Character notes:



- Keep the same main child consistent across scenes.

- Show clear age progression (younger child, older kid, teen, adult).

- One scene may include mom holding a baby.



Editing notes:



- Smooth transitions.

- Backgrounds can be simpler if it helps transitions look cleaner.



Tools and Skills Required



You must have real experience creating coherent multi scene videos with:



- Kling, Sora, Veo (or equivalent high end AI video tools)

- Ability to keep character identity consistent across multiple shots

- AI image generation plus animation workflow when needed

- Video editing skills to assemble scenes, control pacing, and add final text

- If you have access to the tools, great. If needed, I may provide access to certain tools depending on the candidate.



What I Will Provide: 



- The full concept and scene list

- Style guidance and references

- Feedback on drafts



Deliverables



- First draft: full 20 to 30 second clip with all scenes in order

- Final version after revisions (see below)

- Source assets or project files if applicable (optional, tell me what you can provide)



Revisions



Include 2 rounds of revisions:



- Round 1: scene timing, transitions, character consistency

- Round 2: final polish and end card text



Pay Structure



Choose one option in your application:



Option A: Fixed price for the full clip

Option B: Hourly rate with a not to exceed cap (example: 2 to 4 hours for an experienced operator)



How to Apply (must answer these):



- What AI video tools do you actively use (Kling, Sora, Veo, others)?

- Share 2 to 3 examples of AI animated videos you have made (links required).

- Describe your workflow for character consistency across scenes.

- Estimate hours needed for a 20 to 30 second multi scene montage like this.

- What is your rate: hourly and fixed price?

title: Part-Time Bookkeeper (QuickBooks + Stripe Cleanup + Monthly Reporting)
description:
Part-Time Bookkeeper (QuickBooks + Stripe Cleanup + Monthly Reporting)



Remote | Philippines Preferred | Flexible Hours | Long-Term Role



About the Business



We operate two Louisiana-based LLCs:



SugarFreeMD LLC



Stacy Heimburger MD LLC



This is a physician-led business with both a clinical revenue stream (RX/hormone/GLP-1 patients) and a coaching revenue stream (membership, seasonal challenges, evergreen digital products, and 1:1 coaching).



We need a bookkeeper who can clean up our QuickBooks accounts, reconcile last year and this year, and then maintain clean books moving forward.



This is a long-term role for someone who is detail-oriented, calm under pressure, and enjoys bringing order to messy systems.



Main Goal



To clean up and reconcile bookkeeping for 2024 and 2025, then maintain clean monthly books for both LLCs with clear reporting.



Current Setup



Two LLCs (separate QuickBooks accounts)



2 Bank accounts:



Two Stripe accounts (clinical + coaching)



Business credit cards:



Transactions are imported but not reconciled or categorized



No receipt system currently (mostly credit card/bank draft paper trail)



Expenses may be mixed between LLCs and will need cleanup and proper allocation.



Key Responsibilities

1. QuickBooks Cleanup + Catch-Up (Urgent Priority)



Reconcile bank accounts and credit cards for both LLCs



Categorize transactions and create a clean Chart of Accounts



Clean up uncategorized expenses and deposits



Ensure Stripe payouts and fees are recorded correctly



Separate and allocate expenses appropriately between the two LLCs



Prepare books so they are tax-ready



Goal deadline: ideally by March 1, hard stop before tax filing.



2. Ongoing Monthly Bookkeeping



Monthly reconciliation for both LLCs



Maintain clean transaction categorization



Track contractor totals for tax prep support (1099 assistance)



Maintain subscription and recurring expense tracking



3. Monthly Reporting (CEO-Friendly)



Each month, provide:



Profit & Loss for each LLC



Balance Sheet for each LLC



Cash flow summary



Expense breakdown by category



RX margin estimate (Stripe RX revenue vs pharmacy expenses)



Revenue breakdown by business stream (clinical vs coaching)



Also provide a simple written CEO summary in plain English.



Also provide suggestions for streamlining expenses to help company grow.



4. Quarterly Tax Estimate Support



Estimate quarterly taxes (not filing taxes)



Provide summaries for tax preparer/CPA



5. Monthly Financial Review Call



Monthly 60-minute Zoom call to review reports and financial priorities



Optional Phase 2 (Future)



After business books are stable, we may add optional support for personal financial organization 



Required Skills



QuickBooks experience (required)



Bank and credit card reconciliation experience



Stripe reconciliation experience



Comfortable working with multiple LLCs



Strong attention to detail and accuracy



Comfortable cleaning up messy books and asking questions



Clear communication in English



Able to work independently and stay organized



Preferred Skills



Experience with coaching businesses, memberships, or online programs



Experience handling subscription-heavy businesses



Ability to suggest improved systems (receipt capture, reporting dashboards, etc.)



Workload & Schedule



Cleanup phase: approx 10 hours/week



Ongoing: likely under 5 hours/week



Flexible work hours (asynchronous is fine)



Compensation



Hourly during cleanup phase



Goal after cleanup: ongoing monthly support at a fixed monthly rate



We are open to a retainer structure that is fair and stable long-term



How to Apply



Please submit:



Short introduction



Years of bookkeeping experience



QuickBooks experience (Online vs Desktop)



Stripe reconciliation experience



Example of monthly reports you provide clients



Confirmation you are comfortable doing cleanup/catch-up work



Your hourly rate



Your estimated timeline to clean up 2024–2025 bookkeeping



Applications without clear bookkeeping experience will not be considered.

title: CDI Specialist (Clinical Documentation Improvement) VA
description:
Are you a detail-oriented professional with a strong clinical background and expertise in Risk Adjustment Coding and Clinical Documentation Improvement (CDI)? 



Join our team to ensure the highest level of accuracy, compliance, and quality in our patient documentation and coding practices.



Key Roles & Responsibilities

As a CDI Specialist, you will play a critical role in supporting both our administrative and clinical teams. Your primary responsibilities will fall into two key areas: Documentation Management and Risk Adjustment Education/Optimization.



1. Documentation Integrity & Case Support

Chart Quality Assurance: Review clinical charts to identify documentation gaps, errors, and inconsistencies, ensuring compliance with clinical and administrative standards.



Documentation Resolution: Promptly address and resolve identified documentation issues by collaborating with Case Workers and clinical staff.



Administrative Oversight: Accurately process case-related payments and provide support for clinical supervisor activities.



Workflow Coordination: Coordinate across departments to streamline workflow and maintain alignment on case management tasks.



2. Risk Adjustment & Provider Education

Risk Adjustment Optimization: Perform comprehensive chart reviews to identify documentation opportunities for Risk Adjustment Coding improvement (e.g., HCC capture).



Provider Training: Develop and deliver ongoing training and education to Bluestone providers on accurate documentation and compliance with risk adjustment coding guidelines.



Expert Resource: Serve as the subject matter expert for clinical staff regarding coding inquiries and documentation best practices, offering guidance and feedback.



Compliance Maintenance: Stay current with coding guideline updates and assist in implementing CDI initiatives to optimize coding accuracy and disease burden capture.



Qualifications and Experience

Required: 

Certification: Relevant certification in clinical documentation improvement (e.g., CCDS, CDIP) or coding (e.g., CPC, RHIA, RHIT).



Experience: Minimum of [2] years of experience in Clinical Documentation Improvement (CDI), medical coding, or a related clinical role.



Risk Adjustment Expertise: Proven knowledge and application of Risk Adjustment Models (e.g., HCC, CDPS) and related coding guidelines.



Clinical Knowledge: Strong understanding of medical terminology, pathophysiology, and clinical documentation requirements.



Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to provide effective education and feedback to providers and clinical staff.



Remote Work: Demonstrated success and experience working effectively in a remote work environment.



Preferred:

Experience with electronic health record (EHR) systems specific to our organization. 



Background in Quality Improvement or Compliance Auditing.

title: Project Manager
description:
About Us:



Rapid Restore Agency is a leading website design agency specializing in the emergency water damage restoration space.



We don’t just build "pretty" websites; we build high-performing emergency call capture systems that turn panic into profit.



We operate on a partner exclusivity basis (one client per territory), meaning the stakes are incredibly high.



Our mission is to help restoration companies dominate their local markets by delivering world-class assets with speed and precision.



About the Role:



We are looking for an assertive, detail-oriented Project Manager to act as the "Air Traffic Controller" of the agency.



In this role, you will take full ownership of the client journey from "Closed/Won" to "Website Launch."



You will serve as the bridge between the client and our internal production team (Design, Dev, SEO), ensuring timelines are compressed and assets are collected relentlessly.



Your goal is simple but demanding: deliver a world-class restoration website in under 30 days while making the client feel guided, secure, and updated every step of the way.



Key Responsibilities:



Speed to Launch: Drive every project from onboarding to launch in under 30–45 days. Eliminate "client drag" by proactively chasing assets rather than waiting for them.



Asset Collection: Secure the "Emergency Water Damage Restoration Pack" (photos, certifications, reviews) within 7 days of deposit. You must be comfortable pushing busy General Contractors to get what we need.



Quality Assurance (The Gatekeeper): Rigorously perform the Website Quality Assurance Checklist. You are the final line of defense—zero broken links, "dummy text," or mobile issues should ever slip through to the client presentation.



Client Communication: Own the "Friday Morning Update." Ensure 100% of active clients receive a status update every Friday, no exceptions. Translate technical jargon (DNS, Hosting) into simple business language.



Team Collaboration: Manage the 
 board with impeccable accuracy. Ensure no project sits stagnant in a phase (Design/Dev) for more than 48 hours without movement or an update.



Launch & Testimonials: Lead the Launch Call with high energy to resell the client on the finished product. Secure a recorded Zoom Video Testimonial on the launch call (Target: >50% of clients).



Skills & Tools Required:



Assertive Diplomacy: Capable of pushing a busy contractor to send photos without being rude. You know how to be "annoying" in a way that the client respects to get the job done.



Meticulous Eye: You spot a typo in a hero header from a mile away. You are obsessive about Quality Assurance.



Tech-Fluency: You don't need to be a coder, but you must understand the difference between a domain registrar and a DNS record.



Tool Proficiency: You are a wizard with 
, Slack, Loom, PandaDoc, and Zoom.



Process-Oriented: You don't "wing it." You follow the 7-Phase SOP religiously to ensure consistency and avoid chaos later in the build.



Compensation:



This is a performance-based role designed to reward efficiency and ownership.



Pay Structure: $1,000 per managed website launch (Estimated 15 hours + 5 hours buffer = ~$50/hr).



Potential: $4,500 per month ($54,000/year) as you scale to full capacity (approx. 20 hours/week).



Note: Hours may vary initially during the onboarding phase.



Why Join Us?



When you look at our team, you’ll see a group of people "rowing in the same boat" who value extreme ownership and high standards.



We believe that setbacks are part of the journey and that pressure forms diamonds.



You will have autonomy, support, and the opportunity to make a genuine impact on families recovering from home disasters.



If you are ready to treat business like a sport, demand excellence, and refuse to hide behind excuses, we want to hear from you.



Ready to Join a Fast-Growing Team?



If you have the skills and experience to take on this crucial role, apply using the link below.



APPLY HERE:


/build/
Note: Applying directly on this form is the only way to confirm your application. Applications submitted elsewhere may not be reviewed.

title: Strategic Cold Email Specialist - Campaign Optimization & AI Integration
description:
Role overview

We’re hiring a high-agency Virtual Assistant to own end-to-end cold
 fulfillment for boutique, high-value clients. This is a delivery-first role: you will independently build campaigns from client brief ? live campaign ? optimization, own deliverability and technical reliability, and document SOPs so the owner can step away from day-to-day fulfillment.



Key responsibilities

• Full campaign ownership: intake, client research, ICP definition, lead sourcing, copywriting, workflow build, launch, and optimization.

• Lead sourcing & “5 arbitrages”: identify market geography, lead source, generational targeting, personal brand leverage, and timing to find best-fit prospects. Use Sales Navigator, Apify, custom directories, Google Maps, and other sources.

• Build & maintain automation: create 
 (or n8n) workflows that chain scraping ? enrichment ? AI personalization (Claude/GPT) ? Instantly.ai (sending) ? auto-responders. Train prompts/models for consistent tone.

• AI-driven personalization: use Claude/ChatGPT + structured prompts and examples to generate industry-specific, non-AI-sounding copy at scale. Manage prompt engineering and JSON handling inside 
.

• Deliverability & domain management: domain warmup, sender identities, multi-domain A/B testing, bounce mitigation, NeverBounce validation, and troubleshooting flagged domains.

• Monitoring & optimization: daily checks (reply rates, opens, bounce, domain health), weekly optimizations, A/B tests on subject lines/senders/angles, and proactive fixes.

• Auto-responder & qualification flows: configure AI-assisted reply qualification and automated Calendly booking when qualified.

• SOPs & documentation: produce repeatable playbooks (lead sourcing, copy frameworks by vertical, 
 module templates, campaign optimization playbook, troubleshooting guide).

• Client reporting & communication: weekly performance notes, meeting-ready summaries, and ad-hoc troubleshooting updates.



Required qualifications

• Proven experience building and running cold
 / outbound campaigns end-to-end (not just executing parts).

 (or comparable automation), Apify (or scraping tools), Sales Navigator, Instantly.ai (or Smartlead), NeverBounce, Claude, and ChatGPT.

title: Property Accountant (Yardi)
description:
Property Accountant (Real Estate | Yardi)

You’ll oversee monthly bookkeeping, manage close processes, and ensure accurate financials across a portfolio of real estate entities.

mbers with accounting-related questions

Work schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM CST
