title: Paid Ads Specialist
description:
About Us

Eterna Animal is a rapidly growing eCommerce brand in the pet industry, selling across multiple online marketplaces. We are looking for a highly skilled Ads Specialist to join our team. This role focuses on driving conversions through paid advertising campaigns across major eCommerce platforms and Google.



Responsibilities

As our  Ads Specialist, your primary goal will be to manage and scale paid advertising campaigns to drive conversions. You will be responsible for:



Running and optimizing ads on major eCommerce platforms, including:

•
 Ads

• Instagram Ads

• Google Ads



Key tasks include:



- Creating, launching, and managing ad campaigns to drive sales and conversions

- Conducting keyword research and bid optimization for better ROI

- Monitoring key performance indicators (ROAS, ACOS, CPA) to ensure profitable campaigns

- Scaling successful campaigns and pausing underperforming ones to maintain efficiency

- Managing product-level ads and promotions in alignment with product launches

- Providing regular reports with actionable insights and performance metrics

- Collaborating with the team on product launches and promotional strategies



Requirements



Must-have:

- Proven experience running ads on platforms mentioned.

- Hands-on experience with Google Ads and conversion-focused campaigns

- Strong understanding of paid traffic, conversion tracking, and campaign optimization

- Results-driven with a focus on scaling profitable campaigns and increasing conversions

- Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and manage multiple campaigns



Nice-to-have (but not required):



- Experience in the pet industry or related eCommerce field

- Familiarity with ads reporting tools



What We’re Looking For:



- A highly skilled Ads Specialist with a proven track record of running conversion-driven campaigns

- A professional who knows how to optimize campaigns for maximum ROI, not just traffic

- Someone proactive and results-oriented, who can take ownership of campaigns and drive growth

- A strong communicator, able to provide clear insights into campaign performance

- A team player who’s committed to contributing to the long-term success of the brand



How to Apply:

1. To be considered for this role, please submit the following:

2. A brief introduction about yourself

3. A PORTFOLIO showcasing your experience with the platforms listed above. Please include CONVERSION-FOCUSED campaigns you’ve managed (screenshots, campaign results, or descriptions). We want to see proof of conversions, not just ads you’ve run.

4. Your expected monthly salary or hourly rate



Note: Applications without a relevant eCommerce ads portfolio demonstrating conversion success will not be considered.

title: App Developer (Simple Streaming App Wrapper for Vimeo OTT)
description:
We are seeking a skilled App Developer to help us launch a straightforward streaming app for both Android and iOS. This app will serve as a WebView wrapper, directing users to our Vimeo OTT web experience. The project is focused on integration and publishing, without the need for custom UI, backend, or payment systems.



This is a simple, efficient build. The primary responsibility will be to develop the Android and iOS wrappers, ensure optimal WebView performance, handle app store submissions (Google Play and Apple App Store), and assist with basic testing and deployment.



Key Responsibilities:

- Develop Android and iOS app wrappers using WebView to display Vimeo OTT web content.

- Ensure smooth WebView functionality and app performance on both platforms.

- Manage app store submission processes for Google Play and the Apple App Store.

- Conduct basic testing to ensure app functionality and deployment readiness.



Required Skills:

- Proven experience in Android and iOS app development, particularly with WebView integration.

- Familiarity with the app store submission process for both Google Play and the Apple App Store.

- Solid understanding of integrating WebView apps with third-party platforms (e.g., Vimeo OTT).

- Ability to perform basic testing and app deployment tasks with attention to detail.



Nice-to-Have Skills:

- Experience with TV platforms such as Roku, LG webOS, Samsung TV, and Apple TV.

- Prior experience with Vimeo OTT or similar OTT platforms.



What We’re Looking For:

- A pragmatic developer who specializes in straightforward app builds and integration.

- Someone who can execute efficiently with a focus on simplicity and functionality—this project is about getting the app up and running with minimal complexity.

- Ideal candidates will have experience with simple wrapper apps, media app deployments, and a solid understanding of OTT integrations.

- We are looking for someone who is goal-oriented and capable of delivering results within a practical scope and budget.



How to Apply:

To apply, please provide:

1. A brief overview of your experience with WebView-based apps or OTT platform integrations.

2. Examples or links to similar simple app builds or media app projects you have completed.

3. Your estimated project rate or hourly rate.

title: Remote Sales Consumer Advisor
description:
Company Overview

We are a US-based, remote-first consumer services business that helps clients resolve and exit unwanted long-term contracts. Our marketing engine is performing well, and we are expanding the sales team to increase close volume while maintaining a high-trust, consultative customer experience.



Role Summary

We are hiring two full-time Remote Sales Consumer Advisors to support a growing inbound lead flow. This is a closing role, not a cold-calling role. You will speak with primarily older, US-based prospects, educate them on the service, answer questions, guide them through the agreement live, collect required information, and then hand the client off to fulfillment.

This is a strong fit for someone who is confident on the phone, organized in a CRM, and comfortable handling sensitive conversations with clarity and empathy.



Work Hours

Full-time, 40 hours per week

US CST hours by default

Monthly performance bonus: tiered structure based on results

Bonus is tied to cash received, not just closed deals



Key Responsibilities

1) Phone Sales and Closing

Handle inbound and assigned leads, run consultative sales conversations

Build trust quickly with an older US demographic

Clearly explain the service, process, expectations, and next steps

Confidently ask for the sale, overcome objections, and close deals

Close within a typical cycle of same day to 14 days, including follow-ups as needed



2) Contract Review and Client Commitment

Walk clients through the agreement in real time on the call

Ensure clients understand what they are signing up for

Collect required details accurately to avoid downstream fulfillment issues





3) CRM and Lead Management (GoHighLevel)

Log all activity in the CRM with clean notes and accurate statuses

Follow the team’s lead management process to avoid missed follow-ups

Upload new clients into the CRM upon close, then hand off to fulfillment





4) Follow-up Discipline

Execute structured follow-up sequences to recover leads and close within the window

Stay responsive and organized across callbacks, scheduled follow-ups, and inbound replies





5) Performance and Continuous Improvement

Participate in daily quick check-ins during ramp (approx. 20 minutes)

Review performance metrics, identify breakdowns, and apply coaching fast

Contribute feedback to improve scripts, training docs, and call flow





Success Metrics

Contact rate and speed to first response

Show rate for scheduled calls

Close rate and close cycle length (0 to 14 days typical)

Revenue collected (used for bonus calculations)

CRM hygiene, no missed leads, accurate notes, consistent follow-ups

Call quality, clarity, trust-building, compliance with process



Required Skills and Experience

2+ years in phone-based sales, inside sales, or high-ticket closing preferred

Strong closing instincts, objection handling, and consultative communication

High comfort speaking with older US prospects

Strong CRM habits, preferably GoHighLevel (or similar CRMs)

Reliable internet, quiet workspace, professional headset setup

Coachable, consistent, and able to ramp quickly with daily feedback



Accent and Language Preferences

Strong preference for a neutral, easy-to-understand English accent

title: CRM & Data Support Virtual Assistant
description:
We are an Australian based real estate marketing and automation agency seeking a CRM & Data Support role. This role focuses on data collection,  lead research, plus routine admin and CRM hygiene to keep our systems organised and accurate.



I’m looking for someone who is detail-oriented, follows processes carefully, and completes tasks end-to-end with minimal supervision.



Key responsibilities

- Lead research and list building (real estate focus): agents, principals, property owners, suburbs, addresses

- Data enrichment: adding missing details, verifying contact information, removing duplicates, standardising formats

- CRM hygiene: tagging, pipeline updates, contact clean-up, importing/exporting CSVs, and basic quality checks

- Research tasks: accurate information gathering with clear notes and sources

- Admin support: maintaining naming conventions, file organisation, and updating tracking sheets



How we work (non-negotiables)

- You can work independently and follow instructions precisely

- You check existing SOPs/processes before asking questions

- You work inside our tools: Notion, Google Drive, Slack and GoHighLevel

- You communicate clearly and ask specific questions when clarification is needed (with context)



You provide daily updates:

- Start of Day (SOD): what you will work on

- End of Day (EOD): what you completed, links, results, and blockers

- Time tracking is accurate and recorded at a task level



Quality standards

- 90%+ error-free work consistently

- Strong attention to detail (names, addresses, phone numbers, formatting)

- Tasks completed fully before submission

- Quick self-check before submitting work



What success looks like

- You use a standard checklist for repeat tasks

- You identify and report issues early (duplicates, missing data, unclear requirements)

- You suggest improvements that increase speed or accuracy (without changing core processes without approval)



Requirements

- Experience in lead research, data collection, list building, or data enrichment

- Strong English comprehension and clear written updates

- Reliable computer and internet connection

- Confidence using Google Workspace apps: Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail

- Experience with GoHighLevel, Notion and / or real estate highly desirable



Trial step

- Shortlisted applicants will complete a paid trial assignment so I can assess accuracy, speed, and how well you follow instructions and report results.



Next steps:

- Please confirm you read the job details by writing the word “ACCURACY” at the top of your reply.

- Send through a copy of your resume

title: Amazon Marketplace Operations VA
description:
Role overview

We are a multi-channel consumer packaged goods ecommerce brand with Amazon as our primary revenue driver. We are hiring an Amazon Marketplace Operations VA to own day-to-day Amazon execution, protect revenue, and continuously improve listing performance.

This role is part-time to start and is ideal for someone who is comfortable operating inside Amazon Seller Central, enjoys improving systems, and knows how to use data and tools to make listings perform better over time.



What you’ll own day one



Amazon operations

Day-to-day management of Amazon Seller Central

Listing maintenance, variation management, and SKU hygiene

Case management and follow-through (inventory issues, listing issues, reimbursements)

Inbound shipment support and inventory coordination



Listing optimization and performance

Use Helium 10 to improve keyword coverage and search visibility

Identify indexing issues, keyword gaps, and listing red flags

Support conversion improvements through:

Title and bullet refinements

Backend keyword optimization

Image sequencing and listing structure feedback

Track listing changes and monitor performance impact



Amazon ads support

Monitor PPC performance regularly

Make careful, incremental optimizations without breaking winning campaigns

Pull reports and surface insights clearly



Revenue protection and profitability

Proactively track lost or damaged inventory

File and follow Amazon reimbursement cases through resolution

Maintain basic SKU-level profitability snapshots and flag issues



Reporting

Pull and organize monthly reports from Amazon and other sales channels

Consolidate data into clean, reliable spreadsheets



How this role can grow

As the core Amazon foundation stabilizes, this role can expand into:

Supporting other marketplaces (Shopify, Walmart, Etsy, TikTok Shop, 
)

Coordinating freelancers for listing images and A+ content

Assisting with international Amazon marketplaces (UK, Germany)

Taking on broader ecommerce operations ownership





What we’re looking for

Prior hands-on experience managing Amazon Seller Central

Strong working knowledge of Helium 10

Experience improving listings for both search visibility and conversion

Comfort with spreadsheets and reporting

Clear communication and strong follow-through



Nice to have (not required)

International Amazon experience

Experience managing freelancers

Looker Studio familiarity

SOP documentation mindset

title: Creator Community Success Manager
description:
Company Overview

The client runs a creator-led growth business that helps consumer brands scale through storytelling, creator partnerships, and social commerce. The business works closely with creators, especially moms and lifestyle creators, turning them into long-term partners, case studies, and revenue drivers for brands.

This role supports the creator side of the business, ensuring creators are onboarded, activated, supported, and retained without the founder becoming the bottleneck.



Core Responsibilities (Primary Focus)

1. Creator Onboarding and Setup

Onboard creators as official partners once they say “yes”

Ensure creators are properly set up across platforms, including:

Amazon Influencer Storefronts

Instagram Creator Marketplace or brand partnership tools

Confirm creators have the correct links, assets, briefs, and tracking

Make sure nothing stalls after a verbal agreement

Track onboarding status so creators do not fall through the cracks



2. Creator Enablement and Coordination

Act as the day-to-day point of contact for active creators

Coordinate campaigns, drops, collaborations, or charity initiatives

Communicate timelines, expectations, and deliverables clearly

Follow up on missing assets, late deliverables, or stalled communication

Help turn top creators into repeatable case studies or training examples



3. Community Engagement and Retention

Maintain a consistent, supportive presence inside the creator community

Encourage participation, progress, and 
ntum

Help creators reach early wins (first post, first sale, first campaign)

Identify creators who are stalled and proactively re-engage them

Support community events, AMAs, or live sessions with coordination and follow-up



4. Internal Follow-Through and Leverage

Own creator-related follow-ups so the founder is not the bottleneck

Keep creator initiatives moving even when leadership is busy

Maintain simple trackers for:

Creator status

Active campaigns

Outstanding tasks or blockers

Surface patterns, questions, or friction points to leadership



Growth Responsibility (Nice-to-Have, Trained Over Time)

5. Creator Outreach (Secondary, Trained)

Learn and execute a repeatable creator outreach process

Support outreach across platforms such as TikTok, Instagram, and creator communities

Use provided scripts, systems, and tracking

Gradually help source new creators to bring into the ecosystem



Required Skills and Traits

Strong written communication and follow-through

Highly organized and comfortable tracking multiple moving pieces

Warm, professional, and confident working with creators

Comfortable nudging people, following up, and keeping things moving

Able to work independently with light direction

Comfortable in an early-stage, evolving environment



Nice to Have

Experience working with creators, affiliates, or influencers

Familiarity with Amazon Influencer, Instagram partnerships, or affiliate models

Light outreach or partnership coordination experience

Basic understanding of ecommerce or brand collaborations

Some Social media management experience may translate to additional work

light canva graphics support for presentations, hand outs, simple posts

title: GoHighLevel Expert Needed
description:
Please read carefully before applying.



I’m looking for a senior-level GoHighLevel funnel builder who already knows GHL inside and out.

This is not a role for someone learning the platform.



This project requires strong design sense, technical accuracy, and attention to detail. I’m looking for someone who can own the build end-to-end without supervision or troubleshooting basic setup issues.



If this project goes well, it will very likely lead to additional funnel and optimization work.



Project Overview



This funnel includes:



1 main sales page

2 upsells (OTO #1 and OTO #2)

Stripe checkout

Correct upsell logic

Custom domain connection

Basic workflows set up correctly



You must be comfortable building multi-step funnels in GoHighLevel and ensuring everything works cleanly from start to finish.



Scope of Work



Build 1 long-form sales page in GoHighLevel

Build 2 post-purchase upsell pages

Set up Stripe integration

Configure upsell / downsell logic correctly

Connect and verify a custom domain

Ensure all buttons, links, and CTAs route properly

Set up basic workflows (purchase confirmation, access delivery)



Ensure full mobile responsiveness



Apply light styling to match provided design references

This is an execution-only role. Strategy, copy, and visual direction will be provided.



What I Will Provide



Final, approved copy for all pages

Visual assets and design references

Clear, section-by-section layout instructions

Funnel flow and upsell logic



You will not be expected to create copy or strategy.



What I’m Looking For



You are a good fit only if you:

Have proven experience building funnels in GoHighLevel

Are comfortable with domains, Stripe, and workflows

Have a good eye for layout (spacing, hierarchy, contrast)

Pay close attention to details (buttons, links, logic)

Build funnels that work correctly the first time

Communicate clearly and proactively



I’m looking for someone who can own the build, not hand it back partially finished.



What This Is NOT



Not a template install

Not a branding project

Not copywriting

Not training or mentoring

Not ongoing support (unless agreed later)



Budget



$300 USD (fixed)



This assumes:



You already know GoHighLevel well

You can execute cleanly with minimal revisions



Please do not apply if this budget does not work for you.



Future Opportunities



If this project goes well:



There will be additional funnels

Optimization and iteration work

Potential long-term collaboration



I value reliability and clean execution and prefer to work with the same person repeatedly.

title: Lead Generation Specialist for Saas [Experience Required]
description:
What We Do



We help software teams move faster by removing friction caused by messy infrastructure, fragile deployments, unclear ownership, and compliance pressure. Our services include AWS cloud architecture, compliance readiness (SOC 2, HIPAA), on-demand engineering support, and fractional CTO services.



Role Overview



We are looking for an experienced Lead Generation Specialist to drive outbound efforts and consistently book qualified meetings. You will focus on identifying the right decision-makers, running outbound campaigns, and starting real conversations with founders, CTOs, and engineering leaders.



Responsibilities



Build and manage lead lists targeting startups and growing software teams



Identify and reach decision-makers such as Founders, CTOs, and Engineering Leaders



Run outbound campaigns via LinkedIn and cold



Personalize outreach messages based on company and role



Book qualified meetings for technical and consulting services



Maintain clean and organized lead data in CRM tools



Track outreach performance and optimize campaigns



Required Experience

Experience targeting B2B SaaS, startups, or tech services



Familiarity with Sales Navigator,
 outreach tools, and CRMs

Strong attention to detail and consistency



Nice to Have



Experience selling technical services, cloud services, or consulting



Basic understanding of AWS, DevOps, or compliance-related services



Experience booking calls with senior decision-makers



How to Apply



When applying, include the word “Mango” in the subject line so we know you read the full post.

title: Part-time Bookkeeper
description:
Who We Are -



Hello; my name is Casandra Armstrong and I am the President of Carrington Tax & Accounting Services. We are an accounting and tax firm based out of Phoenix, AZ (United States). 



We are a small, but growing company and are experiencing quite a bit of growth.  This has pushed the need for us to hire you, our newest tea
mber.   



We help small businesses, just like ours, maintain, manage, and grow their businesses by ensuring accurate financials, processing payroll for their employees, tax preparation and strategy. We ensure we can take as much off the owner’s plate as possible while building trust within our working relationships. 



You’re probably wondering if you would be our first Filipino tea
mber? 



Actually, no. We currently have 4 tea
mbers who are from the Philippines like yourself.  We have 3 bookkeeping specialist and a tax specialist that are based in the Philippines as well. In addition to them, our operation manager and payroll specialist are US based. 

 

If you’re wondering what you would be doing? 



The job title is Bookkeeping Specialist.  I am looking for someone who can perform detailed bookkeeping for several small business clients well as assist in payroll processing. Your primary duties as a bookkeeper would include document processing, data entry, account reconciliation, ledger management, and financial report processing. Your duties as a payroll assistant will include assisting our payroll manager with designated assignments, client follow up for approvals, processing after deadline, as well as report management. Because we are a small business, we all assist each other in departments. We are QuickBooks based, so a QuickBooks background is required. However, we will also train on processes. 



 

So, why should you join us over anyone and everyone else? 



If you would like… 

1) a steady pay check with the chance for bonuses based on performance,  

2) the opportunity to work from home without a boss breathing down your neck,  

3) a team environment where you work with others to share the work, and  

4 ) if you want to work for a stable, growing U.S. firm,

…then this is a job you will enjoy and excel at. 

 

Are we for real? 



You don’t have to take my word for it.  



Here is what Emmely says about working on the team: 





Here is what Miraluna thinks about working with us:





And finally, Julie’s opinion of us:





 

How to know if you’re qualified for this opportunity? 



We are looking for someone who has bookkeeping experience, complete understanding of debits and credits, assets and liabilties, inter-company transfers, problem solving skills, fluent in English speaking and writing with the experience of speaking directly with US clients, and most importantly someone who can work with little to no direction and meet deadlines. We do not expect you to know it all as we will train you in your position with everything you need to know about our clients and our field for you to be able to excel at your job.  



I do need you to be a good leader- someone who can effectively manage him or herself at the job as well as manage others; someone who has extensive attention to detail, can manage and meet deadlines, follow processes and provide ideas for enhanced processes, problem solve and troubleshoot on their with little to no direction, handle client payroll emergency’s or last minute requests, be able to effectively resolve issues with upset clients. Intermiediate bookkeeping/accounting experience, and QuickBooks experience is required. 



I also cannot teach you to have a good attitude and to be self-motivated.  These are things you must demonstrate in the interview process.  



A successful applicant must be able to demonstrate: 



* A can do attitude, and the ability to work without constant supervision 

* Be able to speak in conversational English and write in passable English as well  

* Knowledge of Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, Dropbox, QuickBooks, and general ability to use windows based software  

* Have or be willing to obtain Internet fast enough to allow for virtual meeting such as zoom and VOIP phone calls without degradation 

* Working microphone and Internet video camera 

* Workstation with 2 monitors

 

So, what are the working hours? 



As I stated before, our company is based in Phoenix, Arizona so we would require you to work during the US business hours, Monday to Friday 8:00pm to 5:00pm Arizona Time 



Although this position is currently part-time, we are looking for someone with the ability to go full-time when needed or work additional hours during busy times. Full-time is expected within 12 months of being hired but is not guaranteed. 



What about pay?



We are serious about hiring someone and are looking to fill this position ASAP.  I also want this to be a real job that can meet your financial needs.  Therefore, pay is negotiable but know I want you to be happy and satisfied working here, and a good pay scale is part of that.

 

What about the 13th Month? 



Wondering if we pay the 13th month?  Unfortunately, we do not. However, we do offer other benefits such as pay time off, holiday pay, and sick time for Full-Time positions. These benefits begin to accrue after your 90 days probation period of a full-time position. 

 

What happens next? 



Since our jobs are so popular we generally get deluged with applicants.  So, I have designed a multi-part interview process to make the process as simple and efficient for all parties.  

 

The first part of the interview process is designed to examine your English-speaking & writing skills, personality type, internet speed and ability to follow directions.  Please realize the initial application process will take a time commitment on your part of roughly 10-20 minutes.  Since this job is intended to be well paying, I hope this time commitment is acceptable to you.  Please be advised that those who submit incomplete applications will be passed over.



If you make it through this first round, we will talk via video chat to answer any questions you may have as well as get to know you better. If this goes well, I will invite you to meet some other tea
mbers, as well as call your references to see if there is still a good fit.



We will then ultimately hire someone.





How to Apply 



Therefore, to submit your application for the job, please complete all of the following and
 them to me at the reply to
 address provided for this ad or 
 if the other
 address is down.



1. Please send me all the following to emmely at carringtontax dot com

a. Your resume

b. Link to your onlinejobs.ph profile and,

c. Names with your relationship for 3 people I can contact whom would say good things about working with you. This could be a priest, former employer, bank manager, school teacher, but no more than 1 of these people can be a family member.



2. Please also complete the tests at the following link and provide a copy of your results:









Please be advised that incomplete applications will be ignored. I know this sounds harsh, but this is a detailed job and I need to know you can follow directions.

title: Real Estate Cold Caller
description:
???? Real Estate Cold Caller (Philippines) – Growth & Leadership Opportunity



Read this carefully before applying. This is NOT a typical VA job.

We are a fast-growing U.S.-based real estate wholesaling company. Our mission is simple:

Help homeowners solve real problems — and build leaders from within our team.

We are looking for ONE high-performing cold caller who wants more than “just a job.”

We want someone who wants to master cold calling, think independently, and grow into a leadership role inside the company.

If you are nervous on the phone, need constant instructions, or only do exactly what you’re told — this role is not for you.



???? Who This Role Is For

This role is for you if:

You are confident, calm, and assertive on the phone

You can think on your feet when conversations go off script

You hate doing the bare minimum

You are self-driven and don’t wait to be told what to do next

You want to grow into a manager role, not stay a caller forever

You want to build a career, not just earn a paycheck

We are specifically looking for someone who wants to:

Become one of the best cold callers on the team

Help train and mentor future hires

Eventually manage callers, texting, and lead flow

Truly learn the real estate investing industry



???? Daily Performance Expectations (Non-Negotiable)

You will be expected to consistently hit:

1,000+ dials per day

100+ real conversations per day

2–3 qualified leads per day

This is a high-activity, high-accountability role.

If those numbers scare you — do not apply.



???? What Makes You a Fit (Very Important)

You MUST have:

Strong English communication (clear, confident, professional)

Ability to handle objections calmly (angry sellers, confusion, skepticism)

Comfort improvising when scripts don’t fit the situation

Strong problem-solving instincts

Extreme attention to detail

Willingness to take ownership of results

We’ve had issues in the past with people who:

Freeze when something unexpected happens

Only complete assigned tasks and stop

Need constant supervision

Avoid responsibility

We are intentionally filtering those people out.



???? Growth, Leadership & Culture

This is not a dead-end position.

If you perform:

You will grow into a Senior Caller

Then into a Team Lead / Manager

Then into training and managing future hires

Potentially overseeing texting, lead management, and operations

We believe in:

Internal promotion

Training leaders

Building long-term careers

A team culture built on growth, accountability, and mutual respect

We want people who want to change their life, not just clock in.



???? Compensation

Competitive base pay $5.00/ Hour

Performance-based bonuses - Closed deal bonuses, performance incentives, etc.

Raises tied to results and leadership, not tenure

Top performers earn more and grow faster.



? Final Filter (Read Carefully)

Do NOT apply if:

You are afraid of rejection

You dislike cold calling

You only want a short-term job

You need to be micromanaged

You are not interested in leadership

Apply ONLY if you are:

Hungry

Coachable

Confident

Driven

Ready to be great



???? How to Apply (Important)

To apply, send:

A short written introduction explaining why you want this role

A 1–2 minute voice recording answering:

“Why would you be one of the best cold callers on our team?”

“Where do you want to be in your career in 2–3 years?”

Applications without a voice recording will not be considered.

title: Quality Control Specialist - Real Estate Media ($7/hr - Detail-Oriented)
description:
QUALITY CONTROL SPECIALIST - REAL ESTATE MEDIA



About Us:

We're a rapidly growing real estate media company serving professional agents in the US market. We pride ourselves on fast delivery and exceptional quality through systematic workflows.



The Role:

We're looking for a detail-obsessed Quality Control Specialist who LOVES catching errors that others miss. This is NOT a creative editing role - this is systematic quality checking with minor photo editing.



Your job: Upload media from dropbox for edit, review edited property photos, catch every small detail (trash cans, crooked angles, blown highlights, etc.), make necessary corrections, and ensure perfect delivery to clients.



What Makes This Role Different:

- This is systematic, repetitive work - you'll follow the exact same process 30+ times per month

- We value ACCURACY over speed - perfection is the standard

- You'll work independently during graveyard shift (12pm-8pm US Central)

- Checklist-based workflows - we have documented processes for everything

- Long-term stability - quality control won't be automated anytime soon



What You'll Do Daily:

- Review processed property photos for quality issues

- Check every photo systematically using detailed QC checklist (verticals, white balance, unwanted objects, exposure, etc.)

- Make corrections in photo editing software when needed

- Upload final images to client delivery platform

- Track orders and schedule deliveries

- Flag any issues that need escalation



You're a Great Fit If You:

? Actually ENJOY repetitive, systematic work (not bored by routine)

? Take pride in catching small details others miss

? Prefer following established processes over "creative freedom"

? Are more interested in perfection than finishing fast

? Like working independently without constant interaction

? Want a stable, long-term role (2+ years)



You're NOT a Good Fit If You:

? Need variety and creative challenges

? Prefer speed over accuracy

? Get bored doing the same process repeatedly

? Need lots of social interaction

? Want to "improve" or change established processes



Requirements:

- 2+ years experience in real estate photo editing OR e-commerce product photo QC

- US real estate market experience strongly preferred

- Advanced Adobe Photoshop and Lightroom skills, or similar softwares

- Experience with cloud-based delivery platforms (HDPhotoHub, Aryeo, or similar)

- Comfortable with photo editing workflows

- Internet: 100+ Mbps upload speed with backup connection

- Equipment: Reliable computer, quiet workspace

- Schedule: Available 12pm-8pm US Central Time

- English: Professional written communication (B2+ level)



What We Offer:

- Pay: $7/hour (significantly above market for detail-focused work)

- Hours: 15-20 hours/week initially, potential to grow to 40 hours/week

- Schedule: Graveyard shift premium rate

- Growth: As we scale your hours increase

- Stability: Long-term role with growing company

- Training: Comprehensive onboarding with documented processes

- Tools: We provide access to all necessary software platforms



Compensation Structure:

Starting at 15-20 hours per week at $7/hour. As business grows, hours increase proportionally. Opportunity to transition to per-project compensation once fully trained and efficient (higher effective hourly rate as you gain efficiency).



---



APPLICATION QUESTIONS (CRITICAL - DO NOT SKIP):



Please answer ALL questions thoroughly. One-word or vague answers will not be considered.



1. DETAIL-ORIENTATION

Tell us about a specific time you caught a small error that others had missed. What was the error, how did you spot it, and what was the impact if you hadn't caught it?



2. REPETITIVE WORK MINDSET

This role involves doing the exact same QC process 30-40 times per month. How do you feel about highly repetitive, systematic work? Be honest - this helps us both find the right fit.



3. QUALITY CONTROL CHECKLIST

Describe your quality control process step-by-step. What specific things do you check for in each photo before delivering to a client? (List at least 6-8 specific items)



4. REAL ESTATE EXPERIENCE

Describe your real estate photography experience:

- How many years?

- What market(s)?

- Typical volume per day/week/month?

- Types of properties?



5. TECHNICAL SETUP

- Internet upload speed: ___ Mbps (test at 
)

- Backup internet available? (Yes/No)

- Computer specs: ___



6. PROBLEM-SOLVING APPROACH

You're reviewing a property and notice an issue you haven't seen before. Walk us through your exact process for handling this - step by step.



7. LEARNING NEW TOOLS

How do you approach learning new editing tools and softwares?



8. WORK STYLE ASSESSMENT

Answer honestly (we want the real you):

- On a scale of 1-10, how much do you ENJOY finding small errors in photos? (1 = hate it, 10 = love it)

- On a scale of 1-10, how comfortable are you with doing the same task repeatedly? (1 = need variety, 10 = prefer routine)

- On a scale of 1-10, how important is speed vs. accuracy to you? (1 = speed matters most, 10 = accuracy matters most)



9. AVAILABILITY & COMMITMENT

- Earliest start date: ___

- Are you comfortable working Philippines graveyard shift long-term (1-2+ years)?

- Do you have any other work commitments that would



10. PORTFOLIO & PROOF

- Link to your real estate photo editing portfolio (before/after examples preferred)

- OnlineJobs.ph DISC assessment (please complete if you haven't already - takes 10 minutes)

- Internet speed test screenshot or link



---



IMPORTANT NOTES:

- We will request DISC personality assessment before interviews

- Proprietary workflows and tools shared only with hired candidate

- NDA required before training begins



This is a long-term opportunity for the right person. If you love systematic processes, catching details, and take pride in perfect work, we want to hear from you.

title: Guest Experience Director - Sierra Sol Elevated Stays
description:
Our Guest Experience Director leads the heart of our hospitality operation. You coach and support our Guest Experience Virtual Agents, champion our elevated standards, and ensure every guest and homeowner interaction reflects the warmth, attentiveness, and care Sierra Sol Elevated Stays is known for.



You’ll oversee daily workflows, maintain quality across all communication channels, lead escalations with empathy and confidence, and help shape a culture of hospitality excellence. This is a leadership role for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and takes pride in creating elevated experiences for guests and homeowners.



You are a core part of our leadership team, not an outsourced call center supervisor. Your leadership brings our Elevated Promises to life every day.



The Guest Experience team will own:

• Proactive outreach and warm guest engagement that drives five-star stays

• Guest messaging and phone communication

• Workorder coordination and task follow-through

• Cleaning scheduling and day-to-day coordination with our local team and vendors



Working Hours

Our Guest Experience team will provide live coverage from 7:00am to 11:00pm Mountain Time (MDT), 9:00pm to 1:00pm Philippines Time (PHT). Each tea
mber will be assigned a consistent shift. On-call after-hour coverage (11:00pm-7:00am MDT) will be handled by an on-call rotation (separate from daily shift expectations).



As the leader for the Guest Experience team, you will work a consistent schedule aligned to our coverage windows (7:00am-11:00pm MDT) and be available for escalations during peak periods and coverage during tea
mber PTO. We will set your core hours based on the final team schedule.



Compensation and Incentives (Direct Hire)

• Base pay: $900-$1,100 USD per month (full-time, based on experience, leadership capability, and hospitality/STR background)

• Internet/tech allowance: $20 per month

• 13th month pay: Provided in December (prorated for partial years)

• Monthly Bonus: Monthly 5-Star Bonus Pool (based on team review quality + individual SLA performance)

• PTO: Accrues at 1.25 paid days per month (usable after 90 days; no annual rollover)



Monthly 5-Star Bonus Pool

We keep the bonus simple, measurable, and tied directly to delivering elevated guest experiences.

• Pool funding: $2.00 USD for every 5-star review received during the month.

• Quality gate: Pool funded only if the monthly average rating is 4.85+ and the review rate is 80%+.

• Distribution: The funded pool is divided equally among the Guest Experience Tea
mbers.

• Eligibility: You receive your share when monthly SLA and performance standards are met. Shares are not redistributed from non-eligible members.

• Leadership role: As the Guest Experience Director, you're responsible for supporting the team in achieving these monthly goals.



Location

These roles are fully remote within the Philippines. However, we are building our core Guest Experience team in Cebu City, and applicants located in Cebu City or nearby areas are strongly preferred.

Concentrating our team locally helps us work more closely, support one another, and build the kind of connected, collaborative culture that lets us deliver truly elevated hospitality. It also allows for optional in-person training sessions, tea
etups, and shared learning opportunities.

Exceptional candidates from other regions will still be considered.



Role and Responsibilities:



Champion the Elevated Promises (Quality & Standards)

• Lead by example in delivering warm, proactive, responsive guest communication.

• Review message threads and calls to ensure tone, clarity, accuracy, and elevated hospitality.

• Coach the team to uphold Sierra Sol’s elevated standards in every interaction.

• Support the team in meeting SLAs and monthly quality goals tied to our 5-Star Bonus Pool.

• Demonstrate calm, empathetic communication during escalations and model elevated hospitality under pressure.



Team Leadership & Coaching

• Provide daily support and real-time guidance to Guest Experience Agents.

• Run weekly 1:1s focused on tone, communication, efficiency, and problem-solving.

• Provide shadowing, feedback, and continuous coaching.

• Help build a positive, supportive team culture rooted in hospitality, care, and growth.

• Oversee shift scheduling and ensure full coverage across peak periods (including weekends).



Guest Experience & Operations

• Monitor queues, ticket volume, and coverage to ensure fast and warm responses.

• Solve escalated issues with confidence, empathy, and well-considered judgment.

• Ensure smooth handoffs and detailed documentation for local field teams.

• Own quality control across guest communication, workorder clarity, and task follow-through.

• Support the team in delivering concierge-level stays across all markets.



Property Listing Management & OTA Updates

• Oversee and quality-check all property listings in Guesty and across all OTAs (Airbnb, Vrbo, 
, etc.).

• Ensure every listing is accurate, consistent, and reflects our elevated hospitality standards.

• Lead seasonal updates: amenities, photos, descriptions, policies, access notes, and market-specific highlights.

• Audit listings regularly for clarity, tone, accuracy, and brand alignment.

• Work with Agents to correct gaps, improve listing quality, and add new information from inspections, field reports, or homeowner updates.

• Partner with leadership to optimize listing content for search visibility, guest clarity, and better pre-arrival communication.

• Ensure every property description enhances the guest journey, reduces friction, and helps set the expectation for a five-star stay.



Local Knowledge & Expertise

• Own the knowledge base for all New Mexico homes and markets: Santa Fe, Taos, Angel Fire, and Red River.

• Maintain deep understanding of seasonal rhythms, weather and road impacts, and guest expectations unique to each area.

• Stay up to date on restaurants, local events, activities, and experiences to ensure the team can provide personalized, concierge-level recommendations.

• Ensure the Guest Experience team knows home layouts, amenities, quirks, access instructions, and “good to know” details through Matterport walkthroughs and photo reviews.



Tools, Systems, and Processes

• Become an expert in Guesty, Breezeway, RingCentral, and internal SOP systems.

• Coach the team on efficient, accurate, consistent use of all tools.

• Identify workflow gaps and propose improvements that strengthen the guest journey and team performance.

• Provide weekly reporting on SLAs, trends, and opportunities

• Identify recurring issues and implement practical improvements to reduce friction and improve reviews



Manager Success Measures

• The guest journey feels warm, seamless, and elevated.

• Message response times and phone SLAs are consistently met (messages within 15 minutes; calls within 30 seconds).

• The team feels supported, confident, and connected.

• Escalations are handled calmly and resolved with care.

• Workorders and tasks are clear, complete, and closed-loop. No missed workorders.

• Monthly average rating stays above 4.85+ with review rate above 80%+.

• The team embodies Sierra Sol’s elevated hospitality every day.

• A team culture that feels like hospitality, not a help desk.

• Comfortable leading day-to-day operations inside Guesty, Breezeway, and RingCentral.



How to apply

Please submit the following:

• Resume/CV

• 3-minute video recording introducing yourself and describing your leadership style and experience

• Speedtest.net result (screenshot)

• Short written samples: How would you respond or lead in the following situations?

1) A guest arrives on a Saturday evening and messages: “The house is freezing and we can’t figure out the heater. Also, the place doesn’t look clean.”

2) One of your Guest Experience Agents has been missing response-time SLAs on weekends and seems overwhelmed. How would you approach this as their manager?

3) These three issues come in at the same time: (1) “We can’t get into the home, the door code isn’t working.” (2) A cleaner calls to say they’ll be 30 minutes late for a turn. (3) “There’s a leak under the kitchen sink.” In what order would you address them, and why?

Suggested
 subject line: "Guest Experience Director - [Your Name]"

mber PTO. We will set your core hours based on the final team schedule.



Compensation and Incentives (Direct Hire)

• Base pay: $900-$1,100 USD per month (full-time, based on experience, leadership capability, and hospitality/STR background)

• Internet/tech allowance: $20 per month

• 13th month pay: Provided in December (prorated for partial years)

• Monthly Bonus: Monthly 5-Star Bonus Pool (based on team review quality + individual SLA performance)

• PTO: Accrues at 1.25 paid days per month (usable after 90 days; no annual rollover)



Monthly 5-Star Bonus Pool

We keep the bonus simple, measurable, and tied directly to delivering elevated guest experiences.

• Pool funding: $2.00 USD for every 5-star review received during the month.

• Quality gate: Pool funded only if the monthly average rating is 4.85+ and the review rate is 80%+.

• Distribution: The funded pool is divided equally among the Guest Experience Tea
mbers.

• Eligibility: You receive your share when monthly SLA and performance standards are met. Shares are not redistributed from non-eligible members.

• Leadership role: As the Guest Experience Manager, you're responsible for supporting the team in achieving these monthly goals.



Location

These roles are fully remote within the Philippines. However, we are building our core Guest Experience team in Cebu City, and applicants located in Cebu City or nearby areas are strongly preferred.

Concentrating our team locally helps us work more closely, support one another, and build the kind of connected, collaborative culture that lets us deliver truly elevated hospitality. It also allows for optional in-person training sessions, tea
etups, and shared learning opportunities.

Exceptional candidates from other regions will still be considered.



Role and Responsibilities:

Champion the Elevated Promises (Quality & Standards)

• Lead by example in delivering warm, proactive, responsive guest communication.

• Review message threads and calls to ensure tone, clarity, accuracy, and elevated hospitality.

• Coach the team to uphold Sierra Sol’s elevated standards in every interaction.

• Support the team in meeting SLAs and monthly quality goals tied to our 5-Star Bonus Pool.

• Demonstrate calm, empathetic communication during escalations and model elevated hospitality under pressure.



Team Leadership & Coaching

• Provide daily support and real-time guidance to Guest Experience Agents.

• Run weekly 1:1s focused on tone, communication, efficiency, and problem-solving.

• Provide shadowing, feedback, and continuous coaching.

• Help build a positive, supportive team culture rooted in hospitality, care, and growth.

• Oversee shift scheduling and ensure full coverage across peak periods (including weekends).



Guest Experience & Operations

• Monitor queues, ticket volume, and coverage to ensure fast and warm responses.

• Solve escalated issues with confidence, empathy, and well-considered judgment.

• Ensure smooth handoffs and detailed documentation for local field teams.

• Own quality control across guest communication, workorder clarity, and task follow-through.

• Support the team in delivering concierge-level stays across all markets.



Property Listing Management & OTA Updates

• Oversee and quality-check all property listings in Guesty and across all OTAs (Airbnb, Vrbo, 
, etc.).

• Ensure every listing is accurate, consistent, and reflects our elevated hospitality standards.

• Lead seasonal updates: amenities, photos, descriptions, policies, access notes, and market-specific highlights.

• Audit listings regularly for clarity, tone, accuracy, and brand alignment.

• Work with Agents to correct gaps, improve listing quality, and add new information from inspections, field reports, or homeowner updates.

• Partner with leadership to optimize listing content for search visibility, guest clarity, and better pre-arrival communication.

• Ensure every property description enhances the guest journey, reduces friction, and helps set the expectation for a five-star stay.



Local Knowledge & Expertise

• Own the knowledge base for all New Mexico homes and markets: Santa Fe, Taos, Angel Fire, and Red River.

• Maintain deep understanding of seasonal rhythms, weather and road impacts, and guest expectations unique to each area.

• Stay up to date on restaurants, local events, activities, and experiences to ensure the team can provide personalized, concierge-level recommendations.

• Ensure the Guest Experience team knows home layouts, amenities, quirks, access instructions, and “good to know” details through Matterport walkthroughs and photo reviews.



Tools, Systems, and Processes

• Become an expert in Guesty, Breezeway, RingCentral, and internal SOP systems.

• Coach the team on efficient, accurate, consistent use of all tools.

• Identify workflow gaps and propose improvements that strengthen the guest journey and team performance.

• Provide weekly reporting on SLAs, trends, and opportunities

• Identify recurring issues and implement practical improvements to reduce friction and improve reviews



Manager Success Measures

• The guest journey feels warm, seamless, and elevated.

• Message response times and phone SLAs are consistently met (messages within 15 minutes; calls within 30 seconds).

• The team feels supported, confident, and connected.

• Escalations are handled calmly and resolved with care.

• Workorders and tasks are clear, complete, and closed-loop. No missed workorders.

• Monthly average rating stays above 4.85+ with review rate above 80%+.

• The team embodies Sierra Sol’s elevated hospitality every day.

• A team culture that feels like hospitality, not a help desk.

• Comfortable leading day-to-day operations inside Guesty, Breezeway, and RingCentral.



How to apply

Please submit the following:

• Resume/CV

• 3-minute voice recording introducing yourself and describing your leadership style and experience

• Speedtest.net result (screenshot)

• Short written samples: How would you respond or lead in the following situations?

1) A guest arrives on a Saturday evening and messages: “The house is freezing and we can’t figure out the heater. Also, the place doesn’t look clean.”

2) One of your Guest Experience Agents has been missing response-time SLAs on weekends and seems overwhelmed. How would you approach this as their manager?

3) These three issues come in at the same time: (1) “We can’t get into the home, the door code isn’t working.” (2) A cleaner calls to say they’ll be 30 minutes late for a turn. (3) “There’s a leak under the kitchen sink.” In what order would you address them, and why?

Suggested
 subject line: "NM Guest Experience Manager - [Your Name]"

title: Content & Social Media Growth Manager (Instagram, Youtube, Facebook)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE (read this carefully)



We are a well-established real estate team in British Columbia (Canada) with 20+ years of experience. Our goal is to grow a strong personal brand on Instagram, YouTube, and
 that builds trust, attracts followers, and generates real business (not vanity metrics). 



This is not a simple posting or scheduling job. We don’t want someone to just "post." We want a growth hacker who can turn 20 years of real estate wisdom into viral, high-conversion content across YouTube, Instagram, and
.



We are looking for someone who understands how content grows, how social media platforms work, and how to turn videos into reach, followers, and inbound leads. We are looking for one smart, creative person to manage and grow our social media presence.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITY



Your job is to grow our online presence using smart content strategy and execution across:



 - Instagram (Reels, Carousels, Stories)

 - YouTube (long-form + Shorts)

 -
 (Reels + Page content)

You will plan content, guide what gets created, package it correctly for each platform, and improve results over time.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PLATFORMS YOU WILL MANAGE



 - Instagram (Reels, Carousels, Stories)

 - YouTube (Long-form videos + Shorts)

 -
 (Reels + Page content)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT YOU WILL DO (day-to-day)



Your role is to plan, improve, and grow our social media presence.



 - Plan weekly content ideas for Instagram, YouTube, and

 - Write strong hooks, captions, titles, descriptions and outlines for Reels, Shorts, and long videos

 - Help d
 what videos to create and how to structure them

 - Turn one long YouTube video into multiple short clips for IG + FB

 - Optimize titles, thumbnails, descriptions, and captions

 - Advise on on-camera delivery and content angles

 - Track performance and improve content every week

 - Suggest new content formats, series, and growth ideas

 - Help position the brand as a trusted real estate authority

 - Develop a cross-platform content calendar that balances Reels, YouTube Shorts, Long-form educational videos, and high-value Carousels

 - Take Sonny’s raw expertise and script it into engaging content that stops the scroll.

 - Identify industry and audio trends early and adapt them for a professional real estate brand

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

INSTAGRAM (must understand deeply)



 - How Reels grow (hook, retention, saves, shares)

 - How to turn views into followers

 - How Stories build trust and drive DMs

 - How to structure content that gets shared by non-followers

 - Why some reels fail and how to fix them

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

YOUTUBE (must understand deeply)



 - How to grow a personal brand channel (not viral clips only)

 - Titles and thumbnails that increase CTR

 - Structuring long-form videos to keep viewers watching

 - Using Shorts to support long-form growth

 - Writing strong titles and designing thumbnails

 - Basic YouTube analytics (CTR, watch time, retention)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 (must understand clearly)



 - 
 Reels and videos for

 - Page growth and local reach strategy

 - Understanding what content works better on FB vs IG

 - Local reach and engagement strategies

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TIKTOK (must understand clearly)



 - Grow our TikTok account using original, platform-native content

 - Plan and publish TikTok videos focused on discovery and reach

 - Write strong, scroll-stopping hooks for the first 1–2 seconds

 - Test multiple angles, hooks, and formats consistently

 - Turn real estate expertise into engaging, easy-to-understand videos

 - Repurpose long-form content into TikTok-specific clips

 - Engage with comments and turn comments into new videos

 - Track performance and improve content weekly

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

GOOGLE MY BUSINESS



  - Post regular updates (listings, announcements, market insights, offers)

 - Upload new photos and short videos consistently

 - Write keyword-optimized post captions

 - Update business info (services, hours, contact details, descriptions)

 - Add and maintain products/services listings

 - Track insights (views, searches, clicks, calls, direction requests)

 - Identify top-performing posts and replicate winning content

 - Report monthly performance and improvement recommendations

 - Ensure branding consistency across all posts and visuals

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What we are NOT looking for:



 - Someone who only schedules posts

 - Someone who relies mainly on hashtags

 - Someone who copies trends without strategy

 - Someone managing 10+ unrelated clients

 - Someone who cannot explain why content works

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SKILL AND EXPERIENCE



 - Experience growing social media accounts (personal brand or business)

 - Strong understanding of short-form and long-form video

 - Ability to think creatively and strategically and content ideas

 - Comfort working with a confident, on-camera professional

 - Ability to analyze numbers and adjust content accordingly

 - You have successfully grown a brand's following and, more importantly, their engagementand lead flow.

 - You know the difference between a YouTube thumbnail that gets clicks and one that gets ignored.

 - Real estate experience is a bonus, not required.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TOOLS YOU SHOULD BE COMFORTABLE WITH:



 - Instagram, YouTube Studio,

 - CapCut / AI Video Editing tools

 - Basic analytics and reporting

 - Google Docs / Sheets / Notion (or similar)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

HOW SUCCESS WILL BE MEASURED



 - Increased reach and engagement

 - Growth in followers and subscribers

 - Better watch time and retention

 - More profile visits, DMs, and inbound inquiries

 - Strong, consistent brand positioning

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

HOW TO APPLY



Please include:



 1. Links to accounts you’ve helped grow (with results)

 2. A short explanation of how you would grow a real estate personal brand

3. One example of a video or post you believe performed well and why



Applications without examples or explanations will not be considered.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please answer the following:



 1. Links to social media accounts you have helped grow

 2. Briefly explain how you would grow a real estate personal brand

 3. Share one video or post you worked on that performed well and explain why



Applications without clear answers will not be considered.

title: LinkedIn Ghostwriter for Psychology + AI Marketing Launch (Immediate Start)
description:
Hi,



I'm Stef Becker, founder of Pi9 Purpose Intelligence®. I'm launching Pi9 AI — a €997 course that teaches solo coaches, therapists, and consultants how to market themselves on LinkedIn without losing their soul.



This is NOT generic "LinkedIn tips" content.

This is psychology-informed, purpose-driven marketing for conscious professionals who HATE traditional marketing tactics.

I'm looking for a Filipino ghostwriter who can help me launch this in the next 50 days.



What Makes This Project Different:



Most LinkedIn courses teach:

"Post 5x/day and go viral"

"Use these AI prompts to hack the algorithm"

"Scale to 7 figures fast"



We teach:

"The world NEEDS what you've been hiding"

"Purpose is a GIFT—you have a RESPONSIBILITY to shine"

"Marketing isn't vanity, it's STEWARDSHIP"

We extract clients' "Voice DNA" (using Enneagram psychology) FIRST, then calibrate AI to write in their authentic voice.



Tagline: "We tune the signal before we amplify it."



The Role:

I need someone who can:



Understand nuanced concepts: Enneagram psychology, Voice DNA, transformation work, purpose-driven messaging

Write in a "challenger" tone: Direct, respectful, no fluff (NOT motivational guru style)

Work FAST without sacrificing quality: 50-day sprint = tight deadlines

Be coachable: I give detailed feedback, you iterate quickly

Think strategically: Not just execute—help me see what's working/not working

Your Target Avatar: "The Invisible Expert"



You'll be writing for solo practitioners who:

Are brilliant at their craft (coaches, hypnotherapists, consultants)

Can transform lives in one session

HATE marketing (it feels icky, like selling out)

LinkedIn = either totally silent OR sounds robotic when they try



Their Pain (7-Layer Invisibility Crisis):

Tried ChatGPT ? sounded robotic ? gave up

Posted manually ? no engagement (didn't speak to PAIN) ? gave up

Profile looks like 2012 CV ? no trust

Post 3x/week ? 12 views ? algorithm buried them

Flannel shirt selfie ? looks like hobbyist, not $5K expert

Competitors crush it with video ? don't know where to start

Know organic is dead ? LinkedIn Ads feel overwhelming



The Emotional Pain:

"I'm squandering my purpose by staying invisible. Someone out there needs what I offer and can't find me."



What You'll Write:

Week 1-2 (Launch Prep):

7 LinkedIn posts (spiritual hooks, pain agitation, solution focus)

Sales page copy sections (hero, problem, solution, CTA)

5
 nurture sequence



Week 3-7 (Launch Phase):

3 LinkedIn posts per week

Ad copy for LinkedIn Ads

DM scripts for warm outreach

Social media captions (if needed)



Week 8+ (Post-Launch):

2-3 LinkedIn posts per week

Student testimonial/case study writeups

Module descriptions for course content

Ongoing
 campaigns



The Tone (CRITICAL to Understand):

NOT:

? Motivational coach: "You can do this! Believe in yourself!"

? Corporate jargon: "Leverage synergies for optimal outcomes"

? Guru-on-throne: "I have the secrets, follow me"



IS:

? Challenger: Respectful but direct ("Here's the truth...")

? Fellow practitioner: "I've been there, here's what actually works"

? Intellectual rigor: No fluff, no hype, respect their intelligence



Example Posts:

? GOOD:

"You tried ChatGPT. It sounded robotic. So you gave up.

Here's why: Garbage in, garbage out.

You handed AI a blank slate. No context about your voice. No data about your psychological patterns.

Pi9 AI is different. We extract your Voice DNA FIRST—using the Enneagram (your psychological blueprint).

THEN we teach AI to write like YOU.

Not louder. Not robotic. Just authentically, unmistakably YOU.

Bridge the AI Marketing Gap: 
"



? BAD:

"Unlock your LinkedIn potential with AI! Transform your profile today and watch the magic happen! You CAN do this! ?????"



Key Language to Use:



USE THESE TERMS:

Voice DNA / Voice Sovereignty

Garbage in, garbage out

We tune the signal before we amplify it

Bridge the AI Marketing Gap

Full-Stack LinkedIn Operating System

Purpose is a gift / responsibility to shine

Marketing = stewardship

Invisible Expert

Marketing paralysis



NEVER USE:

10X your followers

Go viral

Scale to 7 figures

Hack the algorithm

"Game-changing" / "Revolutionary"

Generic motivation phrases



The Spiritual Foundation:

This is what makes Pi9 AI different from every other LinkedIn course:

The world NEEDS what our clients have been hiding.

Purpose is a GIFT. They're not allowed to squander it.

They have a RESPONSIBILITY to shine—not for ego, but because someone out there is searching for exactly what they offer.

Marketing isn't vanity. It's STEWARDSHIP.



Every piece of content must echo this truth.



Requirements:



MUST HAVE:

Excellent English writing (near-native level)

Experience writing LinkedIn content or B2B thought leadership

Ability to understand psychology/coaching/transformation concepts

Fast learner (can adapt tone after 1-2 rounds of feedback)

Reliable internet and can attend Zoom calls

Available to start IMMEDIATELY



BONUS POINTS:

Familiar with Enneagram or personality frameworks

Experience in coaching/therapy/wellness niches

Understanding of AI tools (ChatGPT, etc.)

Portfolio showing "authority" or "challenger" tone (not hype)



PERSONALITY FIT:

Self-starter (I give you a brief, you run with it)

Detail-oriented (grammar, tone, brand voice matter)

Growth mindset (you want to learn and improve)

Not easily offended by direct feedback

Excited about purpose-driven, meaningful work (not just a paycheck)



How to Apply:

DO NOT send a generic cover letter.

Instead, show me you understand the brief by completing this test assignment:



WRITE ONE SHORT LINKEDIN POST (
words):



Scenario: You're writing for a solo hypnotherapist who hasn't posted on LinkedIn in 6 months because "marketing feels icky."

Your post MUST include:

A hook using the spiritual foundation ("purpose is a gift" OR "responsibility to shine")

Reference to at least 2 of the 7 invisibility layers (their pain)

The solution as a "full-stack system" (not just AI prompts)

Challenger tone (direct, no fluff, no motivation-speak)

CTA: pi9com.ai



In your application
, include:



The test post (paste it in the
)

Link to your LinkedIn content samples (if available) or writing portfolio

Your answer to: "Why does purpose-driven marketing matter to you personally?"

Your availability (hours per week, best time for calls)

Confirmation you can start within 48 hours if hired

Compensation & Work Details:



Starting Rate:

$200/month  for 50-day launch sprint

Approximately 10-15 hours per week

Paid weekly ($50/week, paid via WISE)

After Launch (Based on Results):



If we enroll 25+ students: $300/month

If we enroll 50+ students: $400/month + performance bonus ($2 per student over 25)

Long-term ongoing work: $
/month for 15-20 hours/week



Work Schedule:

Monday-Friday, flexible hours (your timezone)

1-2 quick Zoom feedback calls per week (15-30 min)

Fast turnaround during sprint (24-48 hour delivery on posts)



Why the Starting Rate is Lower:

I'm being honest with you: I'm bootstrapping this launch. The starting rate of $200/month is below market, but here's what I'm offering in return:



Training/Mentorship: You'll learn Enneagram-based marketing and AI positioning (valuable skill)

Room for Growth: Salary increases quickly as revenue comes in (documented above)

Meaningful Work: Not boring corporate content—real purpose-driven transformation work

Performance Bonuses: Your success = my success = shared rewards

Long-term Partnership Potential: If you're great, this becomes ongoing work at better rates

If you need $300+ per month starting immediately, I respect that—but this might not be the right fit right now.



If you're willing to grow together and see the potential, let's talk.



Selection Process:

I will review applications as they come in (first-come, first-served for qualified candidates)

If your test post is strong, I'll schedule a 15-min Zoom call within 24 hours

If the call goes well, you start immediately

First week is PAID trial ($50) — if it's a good fit, we continue for the full sprint



Why Work With Me:



GOOD REASONS:

Clear briefs (you won't be guessing what I want)

Fast feedback (I respond within hours, not days)

Room to grow (salary increases as revenue comes in)

Interesting niche (psychology + AI + purpose, not boring corporate)

Respectful collaboration (I value thinkers, not just executors)

Learn cutting-edge marketing (Enneagram + AI positioning is rare skill)



HONEST CHALLENGES:

Tight deadlines during sprint (you need to be fast)

I'm direct with feedback (if something's off, I'll tell you immediately)

Starting pay is lower ($200/month) but increases quickly with results

This is NOT easy work (requires thinking, not just template-filling)



Timeline:

Apply by: Rolling basis (reviewing as applications come in)

First interview: Within 24 hours of strong application

Start date: Within 48 hours of interview

First deliverables: 3 LinkedIn posts due by end of Week 1

Questions to Ask Yourself Before Applying:

Can I write 150 words that challenge someone respectfully (without being preachy)?

Do I understand the difference between "features" and "pain-driven" copy?

Can I deliver 3-5 pieces of content per week during a sprint?

Am I comfortable with psychology language (Enneagram, purpose, transformation)?

Can I handle direct feedback without taking it personally?

Am I okay with starting at $200/month with clear growth potential, or do I need higher starting pay?

If YES to all 6, write the test post and apply now.



To Apply:

Send your application with with Subject Line: "Pi9 AI Ghostwriter Application - [Your Name]"



Include:

Test post (paste in
)

Portfolio link

Why purpose-driven marketing matters to you

Availability confirmation

First strong applicant who gets the tone right wins the job.



I'm reviewing applications as they come in. ????



Love,

Stef

title: Executive Assistant to CEO (Operations & Time Leverage | Real Estate | Night Shift)
description:
This is not a traditional Executive Assistant role.



This is a leverage role supporting a fast-moving real estate CEO who values precision, ownership, and speed.



If you need hand-holding, constant reassurance, or loose expectations—this is not for you.



If you take pride in anticipating needs, protecting time, and executing cleanly—keep reading.



This role is best suited for someone who prefers structure, ownership, and high standards over comfort or flexibility.



Location: Remote / Virtual

Schedule (PHT): Tuesday–Saturday | 11:00 PM – 8:00 AM PHT (1-hour unpaid break)

Schedule (CST): Monday–Friday | 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM CST

Compensation: Starts at ~$7/hour USD (based on experience and performance)

Type: Full-Time (40+ hrs/week)



?



About ZenHomes



ZenHomes is a lean, high-performing real estate company based in Texas. We acquire off-market properties, manage rentals, and operate with clarity, accountability, and systems.



We run a small, trusted team across the U.S. and the Philippines. We don’t do busywork. We don’t micromanage. We care about outcomes.



?



About This Role (Read Carefully)



This is a high-expectation Executive Assistant role supporting the CEO directly.



Even though the position is remote, expectations are real from Day 1: speed, accuracy, follow-through, and emotional maturity.



This role exists to:

 • Buy back the CEO’s time immediately

 • Reduce noise, errors, and dropped details

 • Execute quickly within clear guidelines

 • Improve rapidly through direct feedback



Feedback here is direct and timely because standards are high. The goal is improvement, not perfection—but repeated mistakes signal misalignment.



If something is unclear, elite operators pause and ask first. Once clarified, execution must be fast and precise.



Autonomy is earned quickly through judgment, correction speed, and consistency.



?



What You’ll Own



Immediate Responsibilities (Day 1 Standard)



Calendar & Time Protection

 • Own and manage the CEO’s calendar 2+ weeks out

 • Book, reschedule, and confir
etings

 • Enforce calendar rules with discipline

 • Prepare agendas and context so nothing is reactive



Communication & Coordination

 • Triage incoming messages and requests

 • Draft clear, professional responses in the CEO’s voice

 • Flag decisions cleanly with relevant context

 • Coordinate logistics, scheduling, reminders, and next steps



Task Tracking & Execution

 • Track tasks and open loops in Asana

 • Ensure nothing drops, stalls, or surprises the CEO

 • Prepare before asking questions

 • Execute once aligned—fast and clean



?



Earned Responsibilities (After Trust Is Demonstrated)

 • Handle tenant, guest, and vendor coordination with minimal escalation

 • Surface risks, conflicts, or gaps before they become problems

 • Reduce unnecessary interruptions and “quick questions”

 • Act as a true gatekeeper of the CEO’s time



?



Required Experience & Traits

 • 2+ years as an Executive Assistant, Operations Assistant, or similar

 • Excellent written and spoken English (neutral accent preferred)

 • Highly organized, responsive, and detail-oriented

 • Comfortable in fast-paced, high-expectation environments

 • Emotionally steady and receptive to direct feedback

 • Loyal, discreet, and dependable



?



You Will Thrive Here If You:

 • Think in checklists, systems, and outcomes

 • Take responsibility personally

 • Dislike chaos and proactively fix it

 • Ask smart questions after attempting solutions

 • Prefer clear feedback over vague praise

 • Stay calm under pressure and don’t personalize corrections



This Role Is Not for You If You:

 • Need constant reassurance or validation

 • Guess instead of asking when unclear

 • Take feedback personally

 • Avoid accountability

 • Prefer slow, low-pressure environments



?



What Success Looks Like

 • The CEO’s calendar is accurate, structured, and protected

 • Tasks are handled without reminders

 • Errors are corrected quickly and do not repeat

 • Communication is concise, proactive, and clean

 • Trust compounds and responsibility expands rapidly



?



Why This Role Is Different

 • You get a front-row seat to how a real estate investment business is built and scaled

 • Strong performance leads to expanded responsibility, trust, and compensation

 • This is a long-term role for someone who wants to grow with a CEO—not hop jobs



?



Tools We Use

 • Google Calendar

 • Asana

 • Slack

 • Airbnb / VRBO / Hospitable

 • REsimpli CRM (preferred)

 • NordVPN (provided)



?



Non-Negotiable Setup Requirements

 • Quiet, separate, dedicated home office

 • Two monitors with an external mouse

 • Noise-canceling Bluetooth headset

 • Hardwired internet (minimum 50 Mbps up/down)

 • Backup internet and backup power



Paid Time Off (PTO) 



After completing 90 days of employment, you will begin accruing paid time off equivalent to 10 days per year, accrued monthly starting on Day 91 (approximately 0.83 day per month).

?



Application Process (Follow Exactly)



Step 1: Attach your resume



Step 2: Record a Loom video answering:

 1. Why this role excites you

 2. A time you protected a leader’s time under pressure

 3. A mistake you made—and how you ensured it never happened again

 4. How you handled direct feedback

 5. Two people who inspire you and three traits you admire most



Step 3:

 • Screenshot from Speedtest.net

 • Photo of your current home office setup



?



Trial Period



All hires begin with a 30-day paid trial period. Expect daily check-ins, real responsibility, and fast feedback.



We hire based on performance, correction speed, judgment, and character.
